loans.name: Bertha Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02  hijos, vive en el Sector Iscacatura, estudio educación secundaria incompleta (4to grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace casi varios años, es una de las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de gallinas.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, ella luego los vende en la feria semanal, LA señora Bertha también se dedica a la artesanía.

Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su capital y formar una empresa.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es: Yitza Margarita tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación León 2000, por lo que es un buena cliente ya que le gusta pagar en tiempo y forma. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, hace más de 8 años que trabaja en este negocio, por lo que surgió con la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de la compra de la canasta básica es por ese motivo que siempre le ha gustado este trabajo porque además puede obtener muchas amistades. Para el futuro le gustaría sacar adelante a su familia y establecer su negocio en un buen lugar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así comprar sabanas, ropa interior, calzado, toallas y manteles.
texts.en:
Yitza Margarita has worked with “Fundacion Leon 2000” for a long time because she is a good client and likes to pay properly in due time. Her economic endeavor is the sale of clothes. She has worked in this business as of more than 8 years ago, when the need arose to cover the expense of basic household necessities. For that reason she has always enjoyed this work and in addition because she can make many friends. In the future she would like to improve her family’s condition and establish her business in a good location. The financing she requests is for working capital in order to buy sheets, underwear, footwear, towels and tablecloths.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Pictured here with her husband is Ouk S.. She is 44 years old and they have four children. They live in Phnom Penh City. Three of her children are enrolled in a local high school.

To make a living, she is employed as a servant at her neighbor’s house, earning an income of $2.60 per day. Her husband's job as a police officer at the interior ministry brings in $6 per day and is the family's primary source of income. To help cover the household expenses, one of her children is working at a restaurant as a waiter.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work easily. By doing this, S. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation services.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Florinda Juana

texts.es: Doña Juanita como es conocidad en su comunidad final de la zona palin  su actividad el la siembbra y crianza de animales, plantas medicinales, y flores lo viene realizando desde hace 15 años con ello se ha ganado la vida y la educacion de sus cuatro hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera hoy necesita de la ayudad de Asdir para un credito  para ampliar su negocio y aprovechar la época de navidad y año nuevo en la venta y compra de pollos, con los ingreso poder mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juanita, as she is known in her community of Palin, farms and raises animals, medicinal plants and flowers. She has been involved in this line of work for 15 years and has earned her livelihood and her children's education this way since she is a single mother. She needs Asidr's help in order to enlarge her business and take advantage of the Christmas and New Year's season selling chickens. With the earnings she will improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Kanayo

texts.en:
Kanayo O. is thirty years old and single without children. He sells bags of melons to make a living. He works for long hours to enable him to put food on his table to feed his aged parents. He is a focused, hard worker. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

Kanayo is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of melons to sell. He is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of melons to sell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana, D. 46 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y cariñosa, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 2 hijos; Isabel D. 27 y Marleny D. 14 años.

Su negocio es la venta D. golosinas, su puesto es uno D. los más concurridos, ya que está bien surtido y las personas saben que ahí encontrara el dulce, chupete, galleta, refresco o chocolate, que están buscando. Esto ha hecho que su negocio sea muy rentable y que se dedique D. lleno a él.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas D. trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto D. venta sin descuidarlo. 
Con el tiempo, anhela alquilar una tienda en la misma zona, donD. pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el sexto préstamo al que acceD. Feliciana con MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para que no tenga problemas a su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 46 years old, and is a very hardworking and loving mother. She lives in a rented house together with her two children: Isabel who is 27 and Marleny who is 14 years old. Her business is selling candies, and her place is one of the busiest, since it is well-stocked and the people know that they will find what they are looking for there: sweets, lollipops, cookies, sodas, and chocolate. This has maD. her business be very profitable and full.

What she likes most about her job is to converse with her neighboring saleswomen, since it makes their long work schedules more pleasant. She has been doing this job for four years and what she considers the most difficult is to have to remain all day in her sales location without leaving it. With time, she longs to rent a store in the same region, where she can offer better service to her customers.

This is the sixth loan that Feliciana has had access to with MFP. She knows that this money will help her improve her future, but also she has to bear in mind that she has to pay it on time so that she doesn't have problems with her community bank. With the 1000 soles requested, she will buy more candies in order to improve her salesplace.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas Solitarias” desD. hace 5 años atrás, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 09 hijos. Ella no estudió, se dedica a la compra y venta D. flores.

Domitila nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar más diversidad D. flores para incrementar su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es mantener y agrandar su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que dan las promotoras sobre como mejorar los negocios D. cada una D. las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Domitila has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellas Solitarias” (The Lone Stars) for the past five years. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 58 years old, married, and has nine children. Domitila did not attend school, yet she manages a business buying and selling flowers.

She tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her operating capital. At the moment, she is requesting a new loan for 2500 soles in order to buy a wider variety of flowers to increase her sales.

Domitila says her dream for the future is to maintain and expand her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the training seminars provided by the loan officers. They are a great help in improving the businesses of each of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flowers to sell

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
R. Dinara is the leader of this group. She was married at 20 and her life changed once dramatically – her family life didn't turn out as well as she had expected.  She planned to divorce her husband; however, they got accustomed to their circumstances and together started their own small business with 1,000 ($22) soms. Now their revenue per month is 10,000 - 11,000 ($225 - $250) soms. Soon after solving their family problems, Dinara bought a horse and cow and diversified her business. Now Dinara is 39, a fantastic mother of three children and a brilliant wife. Her eldest daughter, Jayna, 16, is a nice girl who is in 10th grade. Dinara also has a smart boy of 13, who is in 7th grade. And last, but not least, she has a cute little princess named Aydinay,a joyful 3-year-old who is the delight of her parents. Dinara's husband always helps her with selling. They both work at the market and sell flour, fodder and salt, considered to be the most useful and healthiest additives for cattle. This loan which they desire will be used for expanding their range of goods and opening a grocery store later, but their main purpose is to educate their children.

I. Svetlana is 56, a mother of four children and a wife. She works at the petrol station. Her husband transports passengers. Her eldest daughter, Aynura, 30, works at the candy shop; Gulnura, 22, is not working now; Kuban, 20, studies at the university, and Ayday is 14. With this loan, Svetlana will pay her son’s tuition.

S. Bahatgul is a heroic mother of four children and brave wife of her husband, who is 49. Aynura, her eldest daughter, works as a chef in a café, Her son, Aybek, works in Russia. Her youngest son, Altynbe, stays with his parents and helps them bake flat cakes. They began this business with 1,250 soms, but now they earn 15,000 soms per month. They want to get a loan to buy flour and coal for stock. Their plans are to marry their son and build a structure for the summer season in order to bake their flat cakes in comfort.

A. Rahat is single and dreams about marriage. Her plans are to buy a house and a car. She works in Bishkek as a masseur and earns 6,000 - 7,000 soms.  However, three years ago she started a little business with 3,0000 soms, where her mother, Rosa, sells vegetables. The profit from selling vegetables is 7,500 soms. She wants to get a loan to increase their sales circulation and to extend their assortment of goods.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to expand the range of goods and open a grocery store later

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said M. is an entrepreneur and married man. He runs a business purchasing and selling goats and sheep at the Vingunguti auction city center. He purchases from the wholesale animal suppliers and sells retail for slaughtering. He also sometimes sells to farmers. He has been in the business for three years and has managed to expand the business from purchasing five goats up to twenty per month. He is requesting a loan of 700,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Gilda M. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província do Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade que não vai a escola ainda. Fez 10ą classe e mais tarde fez a formação de professores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a mãe enviando valores monetários para despesas caseiras.  
Saiu de Manhiça para Boane através de uma transferência dos serviços, é docente funcionária do Ministério de Educação a 8 anos. Foi formada pelo Instituto de Magistério Primário de Chibututuine a 8 anos, faz cerca de 8 horas de trabalho por dia, não possui nenhum empregado e conta com um salário de 7.872.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pregos, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Gilda M. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, married, and is the mother of a 5-year-old son who does not yet attend school. Gilda studied through 10th grade and later completed a degree in teaching. She lives in her own home with her family, and she helps to support her mother by sending her money for her household expenses. She left Manhiça for Boane because she was transferred at work. She has been a teacher, working for the Ministry of Education, for 8 years. She completed her studies in Education 8 years ago at the Instituto de Magistério Primário [Institute for Primary Education] in Chibututuine and now works around 8 hours a day. She doesn't employ anyone else to help her and she earns approximately 7872.00 Meticales each month. She uses this money to pay for household expenses and also saves some money each month in her bank account. Gilda has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, nails, zinc plates and other items) in order to finish her construction project. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and then furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (zinc plates, cement and other items)

loans.name: Shakilah

texts.en:
Shakilah, aged 34 years, is the mother of four. She currently lives in a family house with a dream to build her personal residential house.

Shakilah owns a lubricants shop in Hoima, Uganda which she has now operated for 10 years. She has come along way in business from charging batteries to selling produce and finally setting up a lubricants shop using savings and credit facilities from Hofokam. She is taking it step by step, seeing her business grow.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase oil and filters and also to clear her farmland for planting.

loans.use: To purchase more oil and filters to sell and to clear her farmland for planting

loans.name: Mrs. Maly Linh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of eight people who all live in Khpob Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Maly L. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Maly L. is a mother of three children, one of whom is a beautician in a local village while the others are enrolled in the local public school. Mrs. Maly L. is a fruit seller and her husband, Mr. Sythorn Chen, is a teacher in a local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for resale

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou D. est un commerçant de 29 ans. Il habite à Sangalkam, une localité avoisinante de la zone de Bambilor. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Il est marie sans enfants. Il gère une boutique depuis 2002 et s’adonne a la vente de marchandises diverses. C’est une activité  qu’il a hérité  de sa famille et a longtemps pratique l’apprentissage avant d’ouvrir sa propre boutique.  Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est l’aspect lucratif grâce auquel il parvient a satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Monsieur D. sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs car il envisage d’ouvrir une deuxième boutique non loin de la première.  Le crédit lui permet a chaque fois d’améliorer  ses profits et de prendre en charge la nourriture et les frais médicaux  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a 29-year-old merchant. He lives in Sangalkam, a locality in the Bambilor area. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch of U-IMCEC since January 2010, and is married without children. Since 2002 he operates a store where he sells various types of merchandise. He learned this activity from his family and was an apprentice for a long time before opening his own store. What attracts him most in this activity are the financial returns thanks to which he can satisfy his personal needs. Mr. D. is requesting a loan for 400,000 francs so that he can open a second store not far from the first. The credit loans enable him to increase his earnings and cover his family’s food and healthcare needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Brgy.Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old and single. Juliet owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Juliet has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting her first loan, of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita Y. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a pig fattening and sugarcane business. She lives in Brgy Jantianon, Amlan, Negros Oriental with her 39-year-old husband, Dendray, and their three children who are between 4 and 14 years old. Two of her children currently go to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and sugarcane business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Amelita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 13th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Amelita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Francisco Pacheco ( Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
La señora Vilma M. forma parte del Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco en la ciudad de Portoviejo, sus reuniones son cada quince días, la mayoría de las socias tienen sus hogares por el sector de reunión.
La señora VilM. tiene como actividad la costura, hace 5 años, le gusta mucho este negocio, también tiene la venta de productos  Avon, los clientes le buscan en su casa; nuestra socia está casada y tiene 4 hijos todos casados, es abuela, su esposo trabaja como chofer.
La señora Vilma lleva 7 años siendo parte de los créditos de la Fundación, y le va muy bien.
 Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en sus negocios, siempre divide el crédito para comprar los productos de Avon y para las telas, hilos, cierres, botones y encajes; sin salir de casa vende los productos de belleza,  cuando le llega el pedido nuestra socia llama a sus clientes y lo retiran de su casa, su tiempo lo dedica a la costura, cuando tiene que entregar varias prendas sus nueras se encargan de ayudarle en las tareas del hogar, es una gran ayuda ya que así puede entregar a tiempo las costuras, nos comentó nuestra socia que el mes que mejor le va en el negocio es diciembre. Compra al contado los productos y deja a sus clientes a crédito en dos o tres pagos. Ella nunca se ha atrasado en los pagos de la fundación se considera una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus trabajo, el sueño es poder hacer algunos arreglos a su casa ya que lo está necesitando.
 
La señora Glenda es socia del banco comunal Francisco Pacheco desde hace 3 años, le va muy bien con los créditos que ha recibido, está casada, tiene dos hijos mantiene un hogar muy estable y feliz, la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de productos de belleza  Yanbal desde hace 5 años,  mantienen un negocio junto a su esposo, venden utensilios del hogar, actividad que vienen realizando desde hace 7 años.
La señora Glenda junto al esposo han salido adelante con sus negocios, cuando empezaron  a vender los utensilios del hogar no les fue nada bien, salieron en contra porque no sabían bien del manejo de las ventas, muchos de los clientes le quedaron mal y nunca les pagaron pero no se dieron por vencidos y continuaron, aprendieron y desde entonces les va muy bien, en los actuales momentos tienen un negocio establecido ya que lo ha surtido con electrodomésticos como, televisores, refrigeradoras y mas, todos estos electrodomésticos los entregan puerta a puerta, dejando a crédito, las cuotas van desde un dólar hasta 10 dólares por semana. El esposo es el que se encarga de realizar los cobros, el negocio lo han extendido a varios cantones de la provincia como Tosagua, 24 De Mayo, Jipijapa entre otros, tienen un aproximado de 5000 clientes durante estos 7 años que llevan con el negocio.
 Con este nuevo crédito que esta solicitando a la Fundación nuestra socia podrá invertir en sus negocios, por lo general ella comparte el crédito comprando los productos de belleza como maquillaje y perfumes y en los utensilios de cocina y los electrodomésticos. Para la señora Glenda el mayor de su sueño es terminar sus estudios y comprarse una casa ya que en los actúale momentos está alquilando.
texts.en:
Vilma M. belongs to the communal bank "Francisco Pacheco," in the city of Portoviejo. The members of this bank meet every 15 days, and the majority of them live in the neighborhood where they meet. Vilma has had a dressmaking business for 5 years, and she enjoys this work very much. She also sells Avon products to her customers from her home. She is married and has 4 married children. She is a grandmother, and her husband works as a driver. Vilma has been taking loans from the Fundación for 7 years, and it is going very well. With this new loan she will be able to invest in her businesses. She always divides her loans by purchasing Avon products as well as fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons and lace. She sells her beauty products without leaving the house; when her orders arrive she calls her customers and they come to get the products, so she can dedicate her time to sewing. When she has to deliver her garments, her daughter-in-laws help her with the household tasks, which is a great help, and this way she can deliver her garments to her customers on time. She tells us that the best month for her business is December. She buys her products with cash, and she allows her customers credit in 2 or 3 payments. She has never gotten behind in her payments to the fundación, where she is considered to be a very responsible person who is dedicated to her work. Her dream is to be able to make some repairs to her house which are needed. Glenda has been a member of the communal bank "Francisco Pacheco" for 3 years, and she is doing very well with the loans that she has received. She is married and has 2 children. She maintains a very stable and happy home. Her activity is the sale of Yanbal beauty products; she has been doing this work for 5 years. She also maintains a business with her husband selling household utensils, which they have had for 7 years. Glenda, along with her husband, has made progress with her businesses. When they started to sell household utensils it was not going well because they did not know how to manage their sales; many of the customers were unreliable and never paid them, but they were not defeated. They continued on, learning, and after a while it started to go better. At this moment they have an established business that is well-stocked with household appliances such as: TVs, refrigerators, and other items. They deliver all of these appliances door to door, and extend credit at payments that go from 1 to 10 dollars a week. Her husband is in charge of making the collections, and their business has expanded to various cantons in the province such as Tosagua, 24 De Mayo, Jipijapa, and others. They have had approximately 5,000 customers over the 7 years that they have run this business. With this new loan that she is requesting from the Fundación, Glenda will use part of the loan to buy beauty products such as makeup and perfumes, and with the other part she will buy cooking utensils and appliances. Glenda's main wish is to finish her education and buy herself a house, since at the moment they are renting.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fabrics, buttons, fasteners, pots, blenders, large frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia O. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Dorotia is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Dorotia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of banana products in the local community. Dorotia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Dorotia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorotia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dorotia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dorotia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nafaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité NAFAYA est créé le 17 juillet 2006 il fait partie du Banc Villageois de VELINGARA FOULBE MAREWE. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. 

Les membres du Groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par centre d'intérêt, c'est-à-dire développer des activités commerciales.

Madame Nafy D., à droite de la photo en grand boubou rouge bordeaux, elle la présidente du Groupe de Solidarité. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants et a la charge d'un enfant qui lui est confié par des proches. 

Elle fait la fabrique et vente de glaces et de crèmes glacées. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des condiments pour la production de crèmes glacées d'une part, et payer les factures d'électricité liées à la fabrique de glace d'autre part. 

Son objectif est de est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale surtout pour la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group NAFAYA was created on July 17, 2006. It is part of the Banc Villageois of Velingara Foulbe Marewe and is composed of ten women who are all from the same district. The group members organized themselves by affinity and by interest center, that is, business development. Ms. Nafy D. (at the right in the photo and wearing a large Bordeaux red boubou) is the president of the solidarity group. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She also has a child in her care who is entrusted to her by relative. Nafy makes ice and ice cream and sells them. Her new loan will allow her to buy condiments for making ice cream but also to cover the electricity bill associated with making ice. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting family expenses, especially day-to-day expenses and the schooling costs for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments for making ice cream

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean G. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba. She is 29 years old and is married with one adult child. Jean owns and operates a hog-raising business, selling piglets in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. In 2007, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Jean is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 43 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en la avenida principal, ella trabaja atendiendo su propio restaurante y este le permite tener el control de sus hijos y ayudarlos con las tareas y demás, La socia ahorra sus ingresos y el de su esposo que es obrero para comprar su casa propia. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su restaurante.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" and lives in Urubamba province, Cusco department. The member is la Señora Segundina; she is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She also has a small restaurant on the main street. Working in her own restaurant allows her to control her children and to help them with homework and other matters. The member saves her income and the income of her husband, who is a laborer, with the goal of purchasing her own home. She requests this loan to improve her restaurant. She values and is grateful for this loan and thus is committed to making timely repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

loans.name: Thann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thann T. was born in 1957 and was selected as the village bank president by thirteen members of this village bank loan located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Thann T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate corn and peanuts for a living. Now her house does not have electricity, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy cables and to pay for an electrician. With the remaining cash, she wants to buy a bicycle.

Mrs. Thann T. is a widow with five children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory and the others are students in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy cables and to pay for electrician and buy a bicycle

loans.name: Sankaire Ole

texts.en:
Sankaire Ole I. is 37 years old. He is married to Evaline Njambi Sankaire and the father of two children. 

Sankaire is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land. He has been farming for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET LTD staff in his area. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend the 24,000 KES loan on maize farming. His maize has proved to be doing very well due to fertile lands in the area and adequate rainfall. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize production. 

His future dream is to practice large-scale maize farming. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Maize farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov V., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

She weaves Cambodian traditional silk to sell for an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a gardener, earning an income of about USD 1.6 per day. The family spends USD 25 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  

V. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more raw silk to weave silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more raw silk to weave silk products

loans.name: Wilson Ngugi

texts.en:
Wilson Ngugi M. is 34 years old and married to Njoki Priscillah. He is a businessman who has a music store on a busy street of Kitale,  Kenya. He has been running this business for the past five years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a friend who is already registered as a client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to increase his inventory by buying more CDs and tapes. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent a permanent shop where he can sell his CDs, and also hopes to open another music store and create employment for other people. 

His future dream is that he will be able to build his own house and be running the shop. Wilson believes he is hardworking and he only needs the resources to attain his goals

loans.use: To buy more CDs and tapes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. She lives in the village of Buenaaventura Sialer in the district of Pitipo in the province of Ferrañafe. It is a rural region to the east of the major northern cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo. She is a single mother with one 17-year-old child. She lives in her family's home.

Rosa manages a small butcher shop. She sells beef, duck, liver, and any number of other meat products that her clients demand. She owns a couple of freezers as well as machines to assist in the processing of the meat. She purchases the meat from local farmers or wholesalers in local markets. Then she sells it to local clients. In addition, Rosa owns a moto-taxi, which she uses to transport her inventory. She also rents it out to a local driver in order to earn additional income.

This will be Rosa's first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan to increase her daily inventory and her business. Rosa has great references among the community and is very well respected. She cares greatly for her family and works hard every day to provide opportunities to her child. She has a grand spirt and drive.

loans.use: Increase her daily meat inventory

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Farming is big in Surallah, where Josefina lives. She is also a farmer like most people in her town. She plants rice and corn crops and also some pineapples. She sells her harvest to the market. She wants to improve her harvest and earn more. Her one child, who is 19 years old, is in college now. Josefina wants to ensure her child's college education so she saves for school fees.

Josefina needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Providing these would improve her harvest and her income. She applied for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner. This loan would be very helpful in buying the farm inputs Josefina needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Felicita Del Carmen

texts.es: Felicita del Carmen A. D. D. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 13 años D. edad. Felicita posee una venta D. productos plásticos como canastas, masetas en diferentes tamaños, recipientes para colocar comida, recipientes grandes para colocar agua los cuales en El Salvador son llamados “guacales”. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes. Es por esto que Felicita desea poder aumentar sus productos, ya que las ganancias D. este negocio son las que le permiten contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna junto a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos plásticos en diferentes numeraciones y tamaños, D. manera que pueda aprovechar las ventas D. fin D. año.
texts.en:
Felicita del Carmen A. D. D. is 32 years old.  She lives in Ahuachapán department with her husband and two children aged 12 and 13.  Felicita owns a business selling plastic products such as baskets, different sized plant pots, food containers and big containers for holding water which are called 'guacales' in El Salvador.  Her business is located in Ahuachapán town market where she has a lot of customers.

Felicita would like to be able to increase her products since the profits from this business are what allows her to have everything she needs in order to live a dignified life together with her family.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more plastic products in different numbers and sizes so that she can take advantage of her end-of-year sales.

loans.use: To buy plastic products to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE D. URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida y venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz),ella venD. en forma ambulatoria llevando comida y chicha al distrito D. Huayllambamba que queda a unos 10 minutos D. la provincia D. Urubamba, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un restaurant para poder vender la comida y chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the "San José D. Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Dominga is 53 years old, married and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food and 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor, carrying her food and 'chicha' to Huayllambamba district, which is 10 minutes from Urubamba province.  Dominga works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  She would like to have a restaurant in which she could sell her food and 'chicha'.

Dominga is requesting this loan to buy products for cooking and making 'chicha'.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for cooking and for making 'chicha' (a corn-based drink)

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal sells vegetables. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. None of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Chantal needs this loan to buy more eggplants and carrots to sell. She says that she has spent eight years in this business. She hopes to build a house from the profits she makes and feels as if she can achieve even more than what she has done already.

loans.use: To add more eggplants and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Martha Imelda G. L. es casada y tiene un negocio de venta de ropa el cual lleva 20 años de operación.
La señora Martha Imelda está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa seleccionada para así surtir su negocio y obtener más ingresos los cuales servirán para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual su negocio a tenido suficiente mercancía para vender y ya solo le queda poco y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Imelda G. L. is married and has had a clothing sales business for 20 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy select clothing to stock her business thus obtaining more income to meet household expenses.

She is grateful for the cooperation of the previous loan which provided sufficient merchandise to sell but she only has a little left and she does not want to decapitalize the business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Las Crisalias Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama crisalias, está ubicado en San Martin Coapaxtongo , dicha comunidad se localiza en Tenancingo en el estado de México. Este grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes, el grupo se llama así por que en la comunidad hay una flor con dicho nombre. La señora Margarita M. A. es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace aproximadamente 19 años, está actividad la inicio con su esposo, su comercio lo realiza en dos comunidades una en morelos y otra en la ciudad de toluca. Quiere este crédito para poder invertir en los insumos y así obtener más ingresos y mayor clientela. Su familia está conformada por un hijo de 20 años y tres hijas de 22, 18, 14, respectivamente, todos aún estudian. El anhelo de la señora Margarita es poder ver que sus hijos puedan ejerser una carrera profesional y con esto tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en: The group called crisalias is located in San Martin Coapaxtongo.  This community is located in Tenancingo in the state of Mexico.  This group this made up of nine members.  The group is called thus because in the community there is a flower with that name.  Señora Margarita M. A. is one of the members of the group.  She has been dedicated to the sale of food for approximately 19 years.  She started this activity with her husband.  She carries out her sales in two communities:  Morelos and  the city of Toluca.  She requests this loan to be able to invest in supplies and thus to obtain more income and a greater clientele.  Her family is composed of a son age 20 years and three daughters ages 22, 18, and 14, respectively, all still in school.   The dream of Señora Margarita is to be able to see her children achieve a professional career, as with this they would have a better future.

loans.use: To invest in supplies for their food businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy essential tools and expand his business

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Om S., 29, owns a grocery shop where she sells many items including cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks, fast food, and other goods. She sells her products to passers-by and her neighbors. She has been running her grocery business for a few years and earns an average of $5 a day.

 To achieve financial stability for the whole family, her husband works as a domestic porter. The couple has only one young child who is still living under their care. Om S. wishes to expand her grocery business and is asking for a $500 loan to be used to purchase a larger amount of grocery items for selling. This loan will provide her and her family with extra income.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, flour, beef, coal, oil, fish, and coffee

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos N. S., a 29-year-old farmer for the past nine years, is the father of three children and is married to Rose. His monthly income is Ksh.8,000.

Amos learned about KADET LTD through an advertisement and is applying for his first loan of KES.40,000 to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to reinvest into his farming activities. Amos is an honest man who is working hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Huralgan

texts.en:
Huralgan is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife in a ger, a  traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. 

Huralgan manages a transportation-service business in his town. He started his business in 2000. He transports construction materials such as rocks, wood and iron.  He earns 28,000 MNT; about 4200 is the net profit from one ride. He transports material 3-5 times per day. He gained much experience and is planning to continue his business in the future. He is an honest man who attributes his business success to his good communication skills. 

He says, "I am trying hard to better my living condition." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy tires and to repair some parts of his truck.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La señora Magda Yorlene F. Landes es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 26 años quien inicio hace siete años con la venta de leña actividad que con los préstamos y ardua labor ha ido creciendo.
El crédito que está solicitando es de temporada para aprovechar e invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Magda Yorlene F. Landes, age 26, is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  

Seven years ago she started selling firewood.  With the loans and her arduous work the business has been growing.

The requested loan is to take advantage of the season and invest in her business.

loans.use: to get firewood.

loans.name: Ranahan's Group

texts.en:
Ranahan, 35, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and brings up four children by herself. She has three daughters and a son; the older daughters are at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven). Ranahan works as a nurse in the ambulance. This year she has just started cultivating agricultural products. She applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase onion seeds and fuel, which is needed for field work. In the future, Ranahan hopes to obtain a good harvest. With the profits received from selling agricultural products she wants to start building a new house. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff. .

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Las Hijas De Maria Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Hijas D. Maria” ya tiene 6 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).   

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lidia que vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene tres hijos. DesD. joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por tener estas cualidades sus amigas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Lidia se dedica a la venta D. bocaditos especiales llamados “Churros”, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria sus productos en carretas acondicionadas para este negocio, ella trabaja con cinco empleados quienes atienden cada uno D. las cinco carretas. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como  por ejemplo azúcar, mermelada, majar, harina y otras cosas más. Ella tiene 51 años D. edad, es una persona con muchas ganas D. superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS HIJAS D. MARIA" has been operating for six years and is comprised of hard-working entrepreneurs who are looking for opportunities to get ahead and proviD. a better future for their children.  The group meets every month in the city of Cusco.  Most of the members live in Cusco, Perú.

Here we meet Mrs. Lidia who lives in the beautiful city of Cusco with her three children.  From a very early age she stood out as a responsible, kind and hard-working person and, for these qualities, was invited by her friends to join the communal bank.  Lidia is a street vendor who sells a type of snack food called "Churros" out of specially prepared carts.  She works with five employees who attend to the five carts.  She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as sugar, marmalaD., flour and other things.  She is 51 years old and very intent on getting ahead and making her business successful so she can give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as sugar, marmalade, flour and other things.

loans.name: Futuro En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Futuro en Desarrollo lo conforman José Dolores, Martha Raquel y Miguel Ángel tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señora José Dolores de 28 años él se dedica a la ebanistería desde hace 6 años el primeramente trabajo en talleres particulares donde aprendió  la ebanistería y luego decidió independizarse.

En la actualidad tiene un pequeño y modesto taller, cuenta con cuatro trabajadores y su meta es tener un taller de alta calidad. Él con el crédito comprara madera principalmente y otros materiales como barniz, lijas…etc. 

Mientras la señora Martha Raquel de 22 años es comerciante de ropa desde hace 4 años y Miguel Ángel de 43 años vende leña desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group Futuro en Desarrollo (Future in Development) is comprised of José Dolores, Martha Raquel, and Miguel Ángel, three hardworking, motivated, and entrepreneurial people. The group's coordinator is José Dolores, 28 years old. He has been a cabinetmaker for six years, first working in shops, where he learned cabinetry, and then working independently.

Now he has a small, modest shop. He has four employees, and his goal is to have an even better shop. With this loan he will purchase mostly wood, but also other materials, such as varnish, sandpaper, etc.

Meanwhile, Martha Raquel, 22 years old, has been a clothing saleswoman for four years, and Miguel Ángel, 43 years old, has been selling firewood for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has 3 children. She attended senior high school. Ama sells palm oil, which she processes from palm fruit. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses the income from her sales to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. She will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit to process and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to process and sell.

loans.name: Lucio Felix

texts.es:
Lucio es un hombre trabajador de 39 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos y una esposa, con los que vive en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La comunidad donde Lucio vive no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, solo tiene luz eléctrica.

Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de mototaxi. Este es un servicio de transporte público, que recorre distancias cortas llevando pasajeros en una moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera para ello. Además, Luis obtiene ingresos adicionales por la crianza de aves de corral y la producción de mango con la que cuenta actualmente.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, para el mantenimiento de su moto y  la compra de fertilizante para su cosecha de mango.
 
Luis cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Lucio is a hard-working 39 year-old man.  He has a wife and three children with whom he lives in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura district.  The community where Lucio lives does not have basic services.  It only has electricity.

Lucio provides a motorcycle taxi service.  This is a public transport service which consists of traveling short distances, carrying passengers on a motorcycle with a cabin in back.  Lucio also makes additional income raising poultry and growing mango.

Lucio is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi.  He will also buy fertilizers for his mango crop.

Lucio has a good credit record.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 31-year-old Mrs. Long’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Bunthorn, assists her with the farm work. On the other hand, the family also works at brick kiln as workers to generate extra profit. They have two children who rely on their income. As this is a rainy season, the couple thinks that they will start to plant crops as annual. But they still have no enough funds to plant. Hence, Mrs. Long would like to ask for loan to pay for plowing costs, to hire domestic laborers to transplant seeding and also to buy fertilizers for her crop growing. Mrs. Long picture a photo with her husband under their house.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, to hire domestic laborers to transplant seeding and also to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a hardworking father who works all day to maintain his farming business. He wakes up early and goes down to the field and visits his rice field. Romulo plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. In the last cropping season in May, he earned a yield of 25,000 PHP and used it to pay electric bills, for daily needs at home and for the education of his three children. His wife does household chores and budgets the income.

As of now, he has just finished transplanting rice seedlings ready for the next cropping season of November. So, he is requesting a loan of 37,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides used for the maintenance of his farm. 

In the future, Romulo wants to achieve a plentiful harvest to earn enough money and save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used for the maintenance of his farm

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo y otras cosas. Su actividad económica secundaria es la  crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y pollos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de las jaulas de los animales. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Margarita was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 47 years old. She currently lives in the same city where she was born and it is where she carries out her economic activities. She has a grain sales business where she sells products such as barley, and wheat. Her secondary business is farming small livestock, such as guinea pigs, poultry, and hens. At this time she requests a loan to carry out maintenance repairs to the livestock cages.

The communal bank "Virgen de Chapi" meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is a well-known touristic and commercial region. It is also known for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi, and it is also the location of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to the livestock cages.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 60 años de edad, convive con su pareja Cirila de 48 años y fruto de ello, tienen cuatro hijos y juntos residen en la ciudad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa construida a base de material rústico adobe y techo de calamina. Felipe, aún cuando era joven trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalero en distintas chacras, con el transcurso del tiempo conoció a su pareja y con la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su familia compró sus propias tierras en la cual viene trabajando de manera vertiginosa. En la actualidad cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y achiotes. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del café por la calidad y la aroma del producto que ofrece a los comerciantes y fruto de ello percibe buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, para que de esa manera avance con mayor rapidez en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado comprará en gran cantidad estiércol y guano de isla para mejorar la calidad de sus frutos. Desea que el destino le otorgue par de años más la fuerza y el ímpetu de poder trabajar sus tierras. Este será su primer crédito de Felipe con MFP y espera beneficiarse con los créditos concedidos por parte de ustedes, para así avanzar y mejorar sus tierras de cultivo. Con el monto solicitado podrá comprar varios sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Felipe is 60 years old.  He lives with his partner Cirila who is 48 years old. They live with their 4 children in the city of Quimbiri, where they have their own house built of rustic materials and a tin roof. 

Even when Felipe was young, he worked on his parents land and at the same time he was working as a laborer on different farms. With the passage of time he met his partner and they bought their own land. With the need to pay the family expenses he has been working very hard. 

He currently has 4 hectares of planted cacao trees, coffee and achiote.  The coffee bean is the product with the highest demand because of the quality and aroma it offers to merchants and as a result he receives a good income.

Normally he works alone, but during harvest season he counts of the help of his children so that he can progress more quickly in the extraction and selection of his product.

With the loan he is requesting, he will buy a large quantity of manure and guano to improve the quality of his products. He hopes fate grant him a couple of years of strength and momentum to work their land. This will be Felipe's first loan with MFP and he hopes to benefit from the loans in order to advance and improve their farm. With the requested amount, he will be able to buy several bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Rouen

texts.en:
Rouen, 61 years old, is married and has one child who is 22 years old and works in a hotel earning $2 a day. A child in the picture is her grand son. Rouen and her husband sell food and drink, earning $20 per day. Every month the family spends $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

Rouen would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy souvenirs for her child to sell and furniture for her own business. She would buy more chairs and tables for her own customers and will help her daughter to buy more souvenirs to sell if the market for them is good.

loans.use: to buy souvenirs for her child to sell and furniture for her own business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 27-years-old and married to Beatrice. They have a child who is two -years-old and who has not yet to started going to school.

William has a retail business that he runs and it consists of selling earrings, necklaces, head gears etc. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him increase his stock.

He hopes to open a cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more earrings, necklaces, etc., to add to his stock.

loans.name: Duo Vergen De Fatima Group

texts.es: Duo Virgen D. Fatima.  este grupo esta formado por dos personas que luhcnan cada dia para lograr salir adelante en su negocio,Ana Paulina D. 34 años y tiene dos hijos,nos cuenta que desD. hace 2 años se dedico a fabricar dulces tipicos,y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido sostener su negocio, ya que ella nos cuenta que sus clientes han aumentado porque se han dado cuenta que los dulces que ella fabrica son D. alta calidad,ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materiales para la fabricacion D. dulces al igual que la siguiente socia tambien esta solicitando el credito para la compra D. materiales para la fabricacion D. dulces,el sueño D. ellas es salir adelante en su negocio,y darles lo mejor a sus hijos para que tengan un mojer futuro.
texts.en:
The group Duo Virgen D. Fatima is comprised of two members who work every day for the success of their business.  Ana Paulina, 34, has two children and tells us that she has been making assorted candies for two years.  She also informs us that her customer base has grown because they've come to know that the candy she makes is of high quality. She gives thanks to God that little by little she has been able to sustain her business.  

Ana, and her fellow group member, are requesting this loan to be able to buy materials for making candy.  Both group members share the dream of growing their business and providing all the best for their children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: buy materials for making assorted candies.

loans.name: Ussama

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single, and lives with seven family members, one of whom also works.

Since 2007, Ussama has been the owner of an office where he distributes lines for the internet. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a large generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Litein in South Rift Kenya. He is aged 26 and has been in farming for 4 years producing tea and eggs for the local market. He also runs a tea retail business at the local market. He is married with one child aged 2 years.

John has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and boost his poultry farming business. He says the income generated will help him improve his family living standards by providing for their basic needs. He plans to improve his business and become a major supplier for the local market.

He sees no challenges, save for lack of capital among smallholder farmers (usually farms supporting a single family).

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana Luz  de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende diversos productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, pan entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues comercia productos de excelente calidad a muy buenos precios además de una inigualable atención a las personas que la visitan; Ana luz es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a trabajar día y noche con el fin de alcanzar sus propósitos, para ella el secreto en su labor es la felicidad pues es así como se alcanza el éxito, quiere ver crecer su negocio y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Ana ya tiene un buen record crediticio y espera que le den de nuevo la oportunidad de invertir en el negocio. Ana Luz tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá fortalecer su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Luz is 51 years old and lives with her life partner and two children. She has a grocery store where she sells various general products such as basic grains, milk, bread, as well as others. Her clientele has grown lately since she sells quality products at reasonable prices and offers them unbeatable costumer service. Ana Luz is a hardworking woman willing to work day and night to reach her goals. Her secret to working hard is being happy. She wants to see her business grow which is why she requested INTEGRAL a loan to buy basic grains, sweets, instant products, dairy products, sausages, etc. Ana already has a good credit record and hopes to be offered the opportunity again to invest in her business. Ana Luz has confidence to strengthen her home and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, sweets, instant products, dairy products, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Entelic

texts.en: Entelic is a 27-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of three and fourteen years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for two years. Entelic requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Maurino

texts.es: Maurino, de 61 años esta casado con Silvia, de 65; viven en su propia casa junto a sus 03 hijos, a quienes desea ofrecer un buen futuro. Marino, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene una carpintería en la cual realiza diferentes tipos de muebles como: camas, roperos, mesas, sillas, entre otros muebles. El trabajo que ejecuta Marino, es de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y lo hace para no quedar mal con sus clientes. A pesar de su edad hace buenos trabajos, comprando madera de calidad y así ofrecer muebles de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dejar contentos a sus clientes por su trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es traer madera de otros lugares hasta la ciudad de Quimbiri; ya que al momento de  subirlas al carro tiene que cargar. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar madera para seguir realizando su trabajo. Este será su préstamo número 07 con MFP, por consiguiente espera de su colaboración para concretar su objetivo. En su banco comunal se lleva bien con sus compañeros y la agrada ser parte ello ya que son responsables y solidarios. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará madera para seguir elaborando muebles.
texts.en:
Maurino is 61 years old and married to 65 year old Silvia.  They live in a home of their own along with their 3 children to whom they want to offer a good future.  Maurino is a hardworking man.  He has a carpentry shop where he makes different types of furniture, such as beds, wardrobes, tables, and chairs, among others.  Mario does his work with great effort and dedication, and he makes sure that his customers are satisfied.  He does good work despite his age.  He buys quality lumber and offers quality furniture.  What he likes most about his work is leaving his customers satisfied with his work.  The most difficult part is bringing the lumber to Quimbiri from other places; he needs to carry it from the time he loads it into the car.

The money from this loan will allow him to buy lumber so that he can continue to work.  This will be his seventh loan through MFP and he awaits your contribution so that he can achieve his objective.  He gets along well with the members of his communal bank and he’s glad to be part of it because the members are united and responsible.  He will use the 1,000 PEN to buy lumber so that he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
La Srta Melissa tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera aun vive con sus padres. Ella es propietaria de un gimnasio muy concurrido en la ciudad de Caaguazú.
Se dedica a dicha actividad hace un poco mas de un año inicio su negocio gracias a la ayuda de sus padres que la ayudaron a montar dicho negocio. Entre sus anhelos esta la idea de ir ampliando su negocio ya que le genera un muy buen ingreso lo que le permite ayudar con los gastos de la casa y aspira a ser profesional algún día.
Solicito de este crédito para la compra de mas maquinarias para su local ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda y desea brindarles la mejor atención que se merecen a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miss Melissa is 19, single, and lives with her parents. She owns a very popular gym in Caaguazú city.
Her parents helped her to open her business a little over a year ago. One of her dreams is to expand her business, since it is generating her a very good income. This will allow her to help out with the household costs. She hopes to get a professional degree one day.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more machines for her gym, since she has a very good level of customer demand and she wants to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy gym equipment.

loans.name: Muniraan's Group

texts.en:
Muniraan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is a salesman. With the loan investment, he will purchase biscuits  candies in bulk quantity and of different variety at wholesale rates. This will allow him increase his profits by selling the items at a profit.

He started this business many years ago. He collects orders from different bakeries and general stores and fulfills their orders to earn an income. 
Muniraan is hopeful that an investment will help her husband earning more income.

She is a housewife and spends her time doing her household responsibilities.

She has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are illiterate and stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Muniraan couldn’t educate them.
Her eldest daughter is 25 years old and she is hopeful that she will be able to save some profits for her marriage as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and candies at wholesale rates for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 33-year-old married father of three children. He lives in Hadramout, Yemen. His educational background is only primary school. He has a grocery store where he sells food and daily home requirements. He started his business long ago and it is the only source of income for him and his family. 

He introduced additional services in addition to grocery goods such as telecommunications and medical services for the people who have urgent needs because of living far away from town.

Recently, Hassan's business faces a financial challenge leading to a decrease in his profit. He has stopped providing people's requirements because of the current bad situations that Yemen has been facing.

Hassan is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase goods to continue supplying clients' requests.

In the future, Hassan is planning to expand his grocery to become a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his grocery

loans.name: Rosmira

texts.es:
Rosmira es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo ha tenido mucha fortaleza y ganas de salir adelante para superar estas dificultades y continuar progresando en su vida. Rosmira anteriormente trabajaba en su municipio natal en su propio negocio de venta de productos de papelería, pero debido a las pocas oportunidades que existían para seguir progresando decidió mudarse para la cuidad y allí comenzó con mucho esfuerzo un negocio de cafetería. Con este negocio ha venido trabajando fuertemente y ha logrado sacarlo adelante y posicionarlo con sus clientes, y de esta manera puede generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos, ya que es madre soltera cabeza de familia. Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece en su cafetería Rosmira ha podido crecer considerablemente y esto le ha permitido brindarles a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una buena educación, además de que han tenido la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Con el ánimo de seguir creciendo, Rosmira quiere ampliar su negocio, por lo que busca que un préstamo le permita ampliar su negocio con un local ubicado al lado de su cafetería.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y manifiesta que así generará un empleo para una persona que lo requiera, permitiéndose mejorarles la calidad de vida a diferentes personas. Rosmira sueña con que su familia pueda seguir progresando y así pueda sacar sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Ampliar su negocio con un local ubicado al lado de su cafetería.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este rubro y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y  obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva es alquilado, está ubicado en una zona apta para la siembra ayuda al crecimiento y desarrollo de las mismas, comercia en los lugares aledaños y ya tiene clientela muy valiosa que lo prefieren porque siempre obtiene las mejores cosechas a precios accesibles además con un servicio único se mantiene a la orden de las personas que lo solicitan; Rafael es un hombre dedicado a su labor, visionario  y dispuesto a superarse pues quiere alcanzar el éxito, en la última cosecha tuvo perdidas debido a las lluvias, por eso en esta temporada quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción necesita comprar insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herbicida etc. Rafael tiene capacidad de pago y muy buenas referencias de conocidos, asegura que cancelara el financiamiento en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que le dará a su  familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herbicida

loans.name: Safiki

texts.en:
Safiki is 21 years old. She is single and she doesn’t have children.

Safiki is a Camfed learner guide who teaches life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. Safiki deals in women's clothing in her shop. She requested a loan from Kiva to expand her business by purchasing many women's clothes like vitenge and fabrics.

She plans to use the profit obtained from the loan to pay for household expenses and expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing many women's clothes.

loans.name: Nadjegueton 7 Group

texts.fr:
