Les 4 membres du groupe NADJEGUETON 7 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
lls sont à leur 7ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Monsieur ADAMA en première position  de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: G.s Los Graneros Group

texts.es:
Don  José  tiene  37 años,  vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa, su fuente principal es  venta de medicina ambulante, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años,sus clientes amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.

Don José con el  préstamo que esta solicitando espera invertir en la compra de pastillas, jarabes, etc. y surtir su negocio de medicinas  para poder cumplir con la demanda que sus clientes le exigen. Su sueño  es ampliar el negocio con la venta de medicina y poder mejorar atreves del tiempo,  esta solicitando el préstamo en forma grupal.

Doña María se dedica principalmente a la venta de comida desde hace varios años.
Don Òscar se dedica a la mecánica automotriz y reparación de bombas mecánicas desde hace varios años.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Septiembre  del 2015
texts.en:
Don José is 37 years old, and lives with his 4 children and wife. His primary income is from working as a traveling medicine salesman, a career he has pursued for the past 15 years along the bus route that goes between Choluteca and Marcovia, and which he entered into with some friends from work. Don José is a very determined person, with the desire to move forward and have a good life.

With the loan Don José is requesting, he hopes to invest in the purchase of more medicine to be able to meet the demands his clients require.

His dream is to grow his business by selling medicine, and be able to improve over time.

Don José is requesting this loan as part of a group. The group includes: Doña María, who works primarily in the sale of food, and Don Òscar, who works in automotive and mechanical pump repair.

Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2015

loans.use: para la compra de pastillas, jarabes, etc. para su negocio.

loans.name: Julia Danila

texts.en:
My Name the Julia Danila, I have a business and I work out of my house. I sell btoh new and used clothes. Also I distribute my product by travelling out of my home community to the neighboring villages. I've been selling clothes for several years. I work with suppliers and I need the loan to greatly increase the amount of inventory that I can purchase at once. I have two children studying and thanks to the income I hope to receive I would like to pay for their school fees.

SPANISH

Mi Nombre el Julia Danila, tengo un negocio en mi casa de habitacion de venta de Ropa Usada y ropa nueva, tambien distribuyo mi producto de manera ambulante en toda la comunidad y aldeas vecinas, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir compormisos con proveedores y cubrir gastos familiares y gastos de educacación de mis hijos, actualmente tengo dos hijos estudiando y gracias a los ingresos puedeo hacerle frente todos estos gastos

loans.use: Compra de  fardos de ropa clasificada y ropa nueva

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business of smoked fish.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Ruai town, in the outskirts of Nairobi, Kenya. Leonard started his hardware shop in 2003 when he retired. He had previously worked as a salesman with three of the top food and other manufacturing companies in Kenya, namely East African Industries, Warner Company, and Proctar and Allan. 
While in employment, Leonard was saving money with one of the Sacco Societies in Kenya called Jitegemee Saving and Credit. After retiring, he pulled together his resources and started a hardware shop with a capital of Ksh 200,000 (US$2,860). His wife who works with Kenya Polytechnic, a technical institute in Kenya, lent him a part of this capital. Leonard started out by renting a small stall by the roadside of the main Ruai – Kangundo road. Unfortunately, the Ministry of Works demolished his shop along with other structures located near the road. This significantly affected his business, but he did not lose hope. Within three months, Leonard was able to rent another shop that has been operating ever since.  
In the recent past, Leonard has been having difficulties in fulfilling his customers’ demands that are increasing day by day because of his fair pricing of goods. By making purchases from his shop, his customers save a lot of time, since, otherwise, they would have to go all the way to Nairobi in order to purchase the same goods. Leornard is therefore asking for a loan of US$350 which he will use to purchase more stock for his hardware shop, including items like jikos (traditional cooking stoves), plastic basins, sufurias (cooking pots), spades, etc. These are items that are in very high demand; therefore, their acquisition will make a big difference for the community that Leonard is supplying. The loan will also help improve the condition for Leonard's children, his aging mother and mother in law who depend on him. He plans to employ two helpers from the community to assist in day-to-day running of the shop. The repayment period for his loan will be 8 -14 months.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a hardware shop

loans.name: Allani

texts.en: Allani N. is 36 years old dynamic woman. She is married to a mechanic welder and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. Allani is a good tailor and clothes accessories seller on the Port-Bouët’s market. She has more than 12 years work experience. She consistently contributes to her family revenues generation. N. has got an important order of school dresses to be delivered for a primary school. N. who joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 has been a good performer. She has always reimbursed her loans in good manner

loans.use: Allani Nzi will use the loan to purchase school dress accessories.

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en:
I am Shugufta I. from Lahore, a growing metropolis. I am a mother of two sons and one daughter all of whom are in school. I make jewelry tassels and my husband is a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled taxi) driver.

Last year I took a loan and my husband bought a rickshaw on installments. The income enabled us to repay the loan and installments on time but we are left with very little money for our daily household expenses. We plan to buy another rickshaw which we will rent to another driver to supplement our income. Please lend us US$ 400.

loans.use: BUY RICKSHAW

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
I am Razia A.. I am married, and I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband owns a donkey cart, which he uses to transport goods from one place to another for various wholesalers.

He does not earn sufficient income to support the entire family. Therefore, we need to expand our business by adding on an additional donkey cart. We will also hire an assistant to help with this added cart. We need a loan.

loans.use: Buy an additional donkey cart

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido I., aged 49, is married with four children, one of whom is an adult: two others are currently studying and the youngest is still very little. Wilfrido is the owner of an ice-cream factory and has all the necessary equipment for this job.

His business is located in a strategic place as the area is one with much passing traffic: it is two years old. His wife and one of his children are left in charge of the shop while Wilfrido oversees the ice-cream making process.

The loan that this client is asking for will be used to purchase raw ingredients which he has to import from Brazil, because they are better quality. He will also be able to obtain a very low price if he buys in bulk.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Wilfrido I. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad, otros dos actualmente están estudiando y el último aún es muy pequeño. Wilfrido es propietario de una fábrica de helados y cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios para dicho rubro.

Su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico por ser una zona de mucho movimiento, tiene una antigüedad de 2 años. Su señora y uno de sus hijos se encargan de la atención del negocio, mientras que Wilfrido se encarga en la elaboración y Fabricación del producto.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de materia prima que tiene que traer del Brasil, porque es de mejor calidad, además consigue a un precio muy bajo si compra en cantidad.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients such as : flavourings, essences, colourings, milk powder, cocoa, etc.

loans.name: Thi Ha

texts.vi:
Mrs Hà is 25. She is a young lady but hard working and determined. She is married and has a young child. She does various tasks to make an income: work in the rice field, raises pigs, sells grocery. Her husband, Quân, is a skillful carpenter. Together, they are a hard working couple so their income is quite stable. She applies to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan of 150 USD to have capital to invest and move forward.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hà, 25 tuổi, là một phụ nữ trẻ tuổi, chăm chỉ, đảm đang, tháo vát. Anh chị đã có hai con nhỏ. Hàng ngày, chị làm rất nhiều việc để tạo thu nhập cho gia đình như làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, đi chợ... Còn Anh Quân, chồng chị, làm nghề mộc rất khéo tay. Vợ chồng anh chị chăm chỉ nên thu nhập gia đình khá ổn định, Chị tham gia chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc với mức vốn vay 2006000đ để bổ sung vốn làm kinh tế.

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina S. is originally from Achuapa near the city of León. Throughout her life, she worked in agriculture and cattle raising. Being a woman of amazing strength, she has worked hard to support her household and cover all of her needs.

Achuapa is located is very far from the city, and is a rural town without electricity. Facing this problem, Georgina uses candles at night, but she has been working towards installing solar panels to power her house. However, each installation requires a deposit beforehand, and for this reason she is turning to Ceprodel for a loan to cover this deposit and better her living conditions. Half a solar panel can power two 50-Watt lamps and a small television. Please help with her investment in house repair so she may provide better living conditions for her children.

Translated by Lily Fu, Princeton University Language Project.

Georgina S. es una dama originaria del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería siendo una dama muy esforzada que a diario lucha por mantener su hogar y suplir todas las necesidades.

El municipio de Achuapa es una localidad muy alejada de la ciudad y se caracteriza por ser una zona rural que no posee energía eléctrica. Ante este problema, la señora Georgina hace uso de candiles por la noche pero al ver que esta problemática puede erradicarse, solicita un panel solar para su hogar. Una vez instalado el panel su obligación como persona responsable es pagar esta deuda y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel solicitando préstamo para cubrir la deuda y mejorar la condición de su hogar de habitación. Por medio del panel solar tiene derecho a dos lámparas de 50 Watts y un pequeño televisor. Su anhelo es ir invirtiendo en las necesidades de su hogar para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: purchase of solar panel

loans.name: Djurabek

texts.ru:
Djurabek Holikulovich G. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. He has secondary education. He does not have a job, but he has his own business - animal husbandry. He has several calves which he feeds and resells. After that he buys young calves and after feeding them for 40-45 days resells again on the same markets. He has a cow house where he keeps them and has been in this business for four years.

Animal husbandry is one of the main types of business in the rural areas. The season of buying and selling of calves is here and Djurabek wants to buy another calve. It will help him increase commodity turnover and receive additional income. He does not have enough money and decided to apply for a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гульмирзоев Джурабек Холикулович проживает в районе Рудаки. Клиенту 37 лет , он женат и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Определенного места работы не имеет, но имеет свое дело. Он занимается животноводством. Имеет несколько бычков , которые откармливает и продает. Затем покупает молодых бычков и после откормки , которая длится около 40-45 дней продает на тех же рынках. Имеет коровник в котором держит бычков.

Занимается клиент этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года .Эта деятельность одна из основных видов бизнеса в сельской местности. Сейчас сезон купле-продажи бычков , поэтому клиент хочет купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот , что даст возможность получить дополнительный доход. Но для этого у него не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. А погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calve

loans.name: Obomo Getembe Kiagasuku Group

texts.en:
Serpine B. is a young Kenyan mother. She is 28 years old with three children. She also lives with the orphaned child of her late sister, who perished two years ago.

Serpine started her business three years ago after accumulating savings from her former workplace. She currently sells ladies' shoes but would like to diversify her inventory by adding children's and men’s collections. As the breadwinner of her family, this would enable her to support both her children and her husband, who does not have a job.

With the little profit that she gets from the business, Serpine still struggles to pay the house rent and feed, clothe, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, she will be able to add more stock and increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Stella L.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 11, plus one additional dependent.

In 2007, Stella established her meat and soft drink business. Stella has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now needs a new loan to buy beef and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To buy beef and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 67 year old widow with two children currently in school.

Comfort started trading in dry fish and yams twenty years ago. Dry fish is a fresh fish that is preserved through sun drying to make it last longer. It is suitable for preparation of fish meals, soup and sauces. She obtains her supply from a town called Yeji. It is one of the major fishing areas in Ghana due to the proximity to Volta Lake.

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy bulk stock of dry fish and yams to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay for her children’s educational fees.

Comfort belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Comfort is seen standing in this photograph wearing a yellowish 'kaba and slit' outfit. The photograph was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of dry fish and yams.

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.en:
Eduvijes C. is a 26-year old woman who lives in a very poor community called Villa Ortega in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Eduvijes lives with her husband and three children, ages 6, 4, and 3, in a small home. She started her business two years ago buying bread in a town called La Romana and then selling the bread to people in her rural community.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy larger quantities of bread, allowing her to reduce transportation costs to La Romana.  It is Eduvijes´ hope that she will one day expand her business to include other baked goods.  Until then, she will continue providing for her family in order for her children to receive a quality education.  In her free time, Eduvijes enjoys going to church and reading the Bible.

Enduvijes is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Restauración.  In English, this means `restoration.´  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. 

On behalf of Enduvijes, the Restauración group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy additional quantities of bread

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 18 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas, de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas microempresarias informales y actualmente están en 8to. Ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, ellas están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de 550.000 mil guaraníes a cada integrantes.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Francisca C., actual presidenta del comité y una de las característica de la señora C. es de que es una persona muy exigentes con sus compañeras especialmente con las señoras impuntuales.

El comité se aboca a un proyecto, como la mayoría de los comités, de realizar una chocolatada para los niños en su día, la misma tienen pensado realizar en el patio de la capilla de la zona, para el efecto ya realizaron con anterioridad actividades para generar fondos.

La señora Francisca, comenta que la única forma de crear algún tipo de satisfacción para los niños es la de trabajar unidos y gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya pudimos conformar una comisión que ya ha dejado sus huellas en el barrio como la de limpiar el patio de la capilla, las veredas de las calles, la plaza municipal, etc.

El crédito que solicitan desean invertirlos en sus actividades que consisten en: venta de chipas, venta de dulces caseros, despensas, venta de carbón, cría de pollos, venta de comidas y venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
The committee is integrated by 18 hard working women from the area of Cabañas, in the city of Caacupé. They are all micro entrepreneurs who are in the eight cycle of the program of the committee of the Entrepreneurial Womens through which each member receives 550 000 guaranis. At the beginning, the committee started its meetings at Francisca C.'s home. Francisca is the current president of the committee and she can be very demanding towards her colleagues, specially the ones who are unpunctual. The committee organizes events, like parties for kids at the church's courtyard in order to collect some funds. Mrs Francisca says that the only way to give satisfaction to the children is to work together. Moreover, she says that thanks to the Fundación Paraguaya they were able to create a commission in order to organize activities in the community as to clean the church's courtyard, the streets, the main square, etc. The women in the committee will use the loan they request now in order to invest in they different activities as to sell homemade candies, potato chips, charcoal, chicken, food and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell homemade candies, potato chips, charcoal, chicken, food and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Bernardino

texts.es:
Debido a L. escasez D. trabajo en su pueblo natal el Sr. Bernardino decidió emigrar a L. frontera a trabajar con L. ilusión D. una mejor calidad D. vida. El empezó laborando para una empresa, por algunos años, poco a poco se fue desilusionando debido a que pues no le alcanzaba lo suficiente para solventar los gastos mas indispensables, entonces decidió dedicarse a otra actividad que le dejara pues mejores ingresos, L. cual encontró en una base D. taxis. Hoy en día le ha ido muy bien, ya que el administra su tiempo y pues eso le permite mantener mas tiempo con su familia.

El esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 375 que pagara en 6 meses para compra D. refacciones y mantenimiento D. L. unidad, el confía que con el apoyo D. Kiva podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Given the lack of employment in his native city, Bernardino decided to emigrate to the border to work all int he opes of having a better quality of life.

He had been working for a company for some years but slowly he became disillusioned because he still did not earn enough money to cover his basic needs. So he decided to try something new, something that would proviD. him with better earnings. He found what he was looking for at a taxi cab company.

Until current day it has all gone very well for him, especially because he can manage his own time permitting him to spend more time with his family.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $375 US that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. With these funds he will purchase spare parts and pay for the labour to repair his cab. He trusts that with the help of Kiva he will succeed.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his taxi cab.

loans.name: Anor

texts.en:
Anor is a single mother of 2 kids. She does not have a husband.

She works hard every day in order to support her family. She sells grocery goods in the markets and on the streets. Anor mostly sells goods to her neighbors.

Anor doesn't have enough money to buy more grocery goods for sale. Therefore she has decided to try to expand her small business by borrowing money. She is asking for $500 for 9 months. She promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuất năm nay 61 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại chị đang kinh doanh nước giải khát còn các con mở xưởng cơ khí sản xuất và kinh doanh tại nhà. Hàng tháng ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ lương hưu của chồng gia đình chị còn có thêm khoản thu 5.000.000đ từ kinh doanh và sản xuất nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định và phát triển.
 Vòng vốn tới gia chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tuất is 61 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1999. She has 3 children , all grown up. She runs a refreshment stand and her children a workshop right in their house. Their family income is about 5.000.000 VND a month plus her husband's pension so they are relatively well financially. This time she is requesting a loan of 15.000.000 VND to inject in their family's businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla S., a 49-year old mother of three children, never minds working double-time to earn a living and have enough food to share with her family. Her husband’s income from driving a family-owned tricycle would not suffice to meet their family expenditures and that’s why she started a hair parlor business.

Her business is situated in their house and the whole neighborhood is coming to her for hair treatments and new styles. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional materials for her hair parlor shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her hair parlor

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, es una diligente madre soltera preocupada por mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Comerciante de 41 años de edad, residente del Barrio. Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua. Hace seis meses se dedica a la venta de ropa usada ambulante comenzó con   su liquidación y remesas que recibe del exterior. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es poder sacar adelante en sus estudios a su hija de 15 años y que esta corone su carrera, como también poder comprar un vehiculo en el que pueda distribuir su mercadería y de esta manera desarrollarse y extender su negocio hacia el norte del país,  y así lograr una mejor estabilidad económica en su hogar. Para llevar a cabo sus metas esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá la compra de 5 pacas de ropa variada para ofertar a sus clientes y público en general sus productos que son accesibles al bolsillo bonitas y de buena calidad, con este inventario podrá obtener mejores ingresos, como ventas.
texts.en:
Mayra is a dedicated single mother focused on improving her family's quality of life. She is a 41 year old saleswoman and resident of the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. Six months ago she began selling used clothing starting with the distribution of liquidation supplies she received from abroad. Her main goal is to support the advanced studies of her 15 year old daughter. She also would like to purchase a vehicle to distribute her merchandise in order to expand her business to the northern part of the country which will help her gain better financial stability for her family. To reach these goals she is requesting a loan to be repaid within nine months to puchase 5 packages of clothing to make available to her customary clients and the general public. With better inventory she will be able to generate more income and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lerch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun C., 55, is a widow with eight children, four sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a farmer. The family lives on an Island in Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phun has been a silk weaver for 42 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then sell them at a market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $1000. She will use some of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and some of it to help her daughter with her farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to use for farming.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Ruth has been in this business for the past 5 years. She travels to republic of Benin to buy her supplies (a journey of about four hours by bus) and she goes to the market once a week. Ruth is 40 years old and she has 3 children. Ruth needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Estanisla

texts.en:
Estanisla B. has owned and operated a small store in her neighborhood in Itá, Paraguay, for about four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise and goods for the store, which is already one of the best-stocked in the area. She hopes to have enough capital to buy her standard items, like sugar, noodles and beer, in bulk. But she also makes sure to have “de todo un poco” (a little of everything).

Estanisla and her husband, who travels throughout the region as a salesman, work very hard to support their 11-year-old son. She stated that while sales have slowed a bit because of difficulties in the economy, she overcomes this by working harder. In addition to attending to her store, she goes door-to-door with her products to reach clients who wouldn’t otherwise walk by her street. She says these efforts make up for any sales she loses at the store.

Estanisla says she is always trying to grow her business, and with the loan she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, she is confident that she will continue to do so.

loans.use: Merchandise such as sugar, noodles and beer

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely S. is the mother of eight whose husband is a carpenter. She has been a member of ASHI, a Kiva field partner, since 2000. ASHI helped her start a business raising cattle, and she also raises pigs.

Fely plans to use the proceeds of the loan she is applying for to buy two new cows and two pigs, along with feed and supplements for her animals. In the future, she would like to expand her hog-raising business even more. If she has enough income, Fely would like to make improvements to her house so she and her family can live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy two cattle and two pigs

loans.name: Martha Odili

texts.es: La señora Martha vende granos básicos, leñas y refrescos, es una abarrotería que administra desde hace siete años, ella tiene 49 años de edad, reside en Casimiro Sotelo, tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, y trabajan y apoyan para los gastos, con este crédito va  invertir en la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados, jugos, golosinas entre otros para llenar su inventario y vender mas, para obtener mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su nivel de vida, a si como apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha sells staple grains, wood, and soft drinks in a small grocery store which she has run for seven years. She is 49 years old, lives in Casimiro Sotelo, and has five adult children who work and help pay for household expenses.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of staple grains, canned foods, juices, sweets, and other items to expand her inventory and sell more. She will thereby increase her profits and be able to improve her standard of living and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains and canned foods

loans.name: Nyakabirizi Amina Matovu Group

texts.en: Amina M. is age 45 and married with five children schooling. She has been selling groceries for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase things in wholesale such as beans, onions, tomatoes, sweet bananas, etc. She is a hardworking woman and her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale beans, onions, tomatoes, sweet bananas, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 41 ans, Madame Mariam Sangaré vit dans une famille polygame avec ses 8 enfants, son mari, et sa coépouse dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grande mère qui vendait des condiments. Ayant assimilé les tenants et aboutissants du commerce, Mariam  décide de s’installer de la vente de légumes. Avec ses 17 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise cette activité et y est très appréciée et sollicitée. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, qu’elle décide de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son à son  prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter, une grande quantité de légumes dans les villages environnants de Bougouni, à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et à Sikasso. Ses ventes sont réalisées au marché de Bougouni au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle compte agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam Sangaré, age 41, lives in a polygamous family with eight children, her husband, and her co-wife in the Faraba district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She soon dropped out of school in favor of earning an income at the side of her grandmother, who used to sell condiments. Having assimilated the ins and outs of commerce, Mariam decided to get situated with selling vegetables. With her 17 years of experience, she has a command of this business and is highly valued and in demand because of it. Concerned about satisfying her ever-growing customer base, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her ... individual loan. She intends to buy a large quantity of vegetable in the villages surround Bougouni, in Bamako (capital of Mali), and in Sikasso. Her sales are made, cash or credit accepted, at the Bougouni marketplace at the retail level. Her customers are composed essentially of women. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly proit of 25,000 francs CFA that is intended for expanding her enterprise, so that she can become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Sanginchon

texts.ru: Тагоева Сангинчон проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 70 лет. Вдова, имеет 7 детей. Сангинчон более 10 лет занимается животноводством, ей в этом помогают его дети. Клиентка хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить телят для откармливания и в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en:
Sanginchon T. lives in the Varzob district. She is 70 years old, a widow and has 7 children. Sanginchon has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. Her children help her with this business. Our client wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase calves to feed and subsequently sell.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 21 years old and is a married mother of two. She lives with her husband and children in Sefwi Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Rita is a very resourceful mother to her children. She sells eggs in the community market where she lives. Rita gets her stock from retailers and resells them boiled or raw. She complains that the retailers sell eggs to her at a high price, which makes it difficult for her to save. She is requesting for this loan to travel to the poultry farmers so that she can buy eggs in bulk. This, Rita believes, would help her save more to provide better support for her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Al Abrigo Del Altisimo Group

texts.en:
Alicia G. (fourth from left) lives in Mata D. Palma, a neighborhood just outsiD. of San Pedro D. Macorís in the Dominican Republic. Mata D. Palma is a developing town; there is some running water but still no electricity. Alicia requested her first loan with Esperanza two years ago and began selling fried goods on the streets. Her business has since expanded beyond fried food to incluD. selling a variety of chips, candy, and everyday hygiene products, such as shampoo and soap. Alicia is now on her seventh loan with Esperanza, and with this loan she hopes to restock her inventory with her usual products and bring in new products to keep her clientele and attract new customers. Just like the name of their bank states "below the wings of the highest," Alicia states that she hopes she will always put herself and her business in line according to God’s plan.

Please consider loaning to Alicia and her group! Esperanza thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production; restocking existing items; new items

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah N. is 40 years old and the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is married with four children, ages 23 to 7 years old, all of whom are still in school as she cares for one dependent. Sarah has had a retail shop and a hotel in Burunga T/C for over ten years, and it’s because of her customers’ loyalty that she has managed her businesses. She has a dream of transforming her hotel into a modern one and to have all her children educated. Sarah is a determined and hardworking lady and she needs a loan to help buy more food items and accessories like plates, spoons and folks for her hotel and for restocking her retail shop.

loans.use: Purchasing food items and dishware for her hotel, plus restocking the retail shop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is fifty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all out school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Esther is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. Esther procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is divorced. She sells shoes at the central market in Belaya Tserkov. Larisa has been in sales business for 10 years. During this time she tried selling different types of goods. Finally she decided to sell shoes. Larisa enjoys her business and has a desire to develop it further. Larisa lives with two daughters in an apartment. She would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to purchase fall collection of shoes.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Janet Nalukwago's Group

texts.en:
Janet is a 25-year-old single mother of one child aged 6 years who goes to school. Janet also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she lives with five people. There is electricity but no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

Janet resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala in Lugala Kosovo zone. She works seven days a week. She buys vegetables and fruit from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city, and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She also pays daily market dues of 700/= a day.

Janet sells to all categories of people. She has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for one week. She is servicing her first loan and wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of onions and baskets of oranges, tomatoes and pineapples.

Janet is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and wants to start going to buy directly from villages.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Albina es casada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Albina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales menores, quesos, productos que vende en la ciudad de Lima además vende panes. Albina también tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Albina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, carne, azúcar y arroz.
Albina sueña con mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de queso, carne, azúcar y arroz.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es madre soltera, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad. Fue abandonada por su esposo cuando nació su hijo y desde ese entonces vive junto a su madre en el caserío Las Pampas, distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y cincuenta minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica al comercio de animales menores (ganado ovino, caprino y aves de corral). Ella recorre los caseríos aledaños para comprar los animales que luego venderá en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que matiene a su hijo y a su madre, que es de edad avanzada.

Victoria se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más animales y en los gastos de transporte que tiene que hacer continuamente para movilizarse desde su casa hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo llevando su mercadería.

Su más grande anhelo es ayudar a su hijo a estudiar una carrera profesional con la cual pueda asegurarse un futuro estable. Ella es una madre entregada a su trabajo y que lucha continuamente por darle a su familia el bienestar que necesita.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 42-year-old single mother with a 13-year-old son. She was abandoned by her husband after her son was born, and ever since she has lived with her mother in Las Pampas, Olmos District, located an hour and 50 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, she has had a business selling small animals (sheep, goats and poultry). She visits neighboring farmhouses to buy the animals, then sells them in the city of Chiclayo. This is the only source of income available to Victoria to support herself, her son and her elderly mother. This is the first loan request Victoria has made at Edpyme Alternativa; she is requesting 1000 soles to buy more animals and pay her transportation expenses to travel from her home to the city of Chiclayo, where she sells her animals. Her greatest dream is to help her son study a professional career in order to secure a stable future for himself. She is very dedicated to her work, and she struggles constantly to guarantee her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to resell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: La señora Milagros, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun depende de ella.Milagros, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 06 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Milagros, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Señora Milagros belongs to the communal bank "Active Women," an affiliate of Kiva in the District of Bellavista, province of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She is married, 29 years old, and the mother of three children that depend on her. Milagros is a woman who likes to work, so she decided to open her own soft drinks business located in her house, in a very well located area. She is the administrator of her business, without a having a schedule or a boss. She started with 300 S. and began buying six packages of drinks, but they sold very well and she could have sold more, but little by little she invested in more. Currently, she continues in this same business, but she is already known by her clients. With this loan of 1,000 S., she will buy soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands, like mineral water and bottled water. Milagros has many goals in front of her and feels motivated by her proposal. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed it most, and is responsible with her repayment to them, and will continue to be responsible in paying back her loans..

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Esperanza María

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza O. se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y por tener su propio negocio de venta de recordatorios y adornos ofrecidos en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega donde es visitada por clientes que compran los recordatorios.
Es de suma importancia destacar que ella comenzó este negocio con el apoyo de sus padres aportándole para su inversión inicial y hoy lo ha desarrollado cabalmente gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de los recordatorios y adornos y de esta manera continuar ofertándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza O. is known for being a very hard worker. She has a business selling souvenirs and ornaments from her store in the department of Chinandenga. Her customers visit her whenever they want to buy mementos.

It is important to note that Esperanza started her business with the help of her parents, who provided the initial investment. Today her business is now fully developed thanks to all of her efforts. She is requesting a loan to purchase more souvenirs and ornaments to offer from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase souvenirs and ornaments

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 8 hijos (4 de ellos viven con ella y 4 tienen su familia).
Andrea se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar los materiales necesarios para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà lana, bayeta y anilima.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su alimentación y vivir tranquila. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Andrea has been a member of the community bank "Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli" for 5 years. She is from the district of Juli in the province of Chucuito in the department of Puno. She is 49 years old, has not studied, is married, and has 8 children (4 of whom live with her and 4 of whom have their own family). Andrea dedicates herself to selling handicrafts and tells us that with the first loan of 500 PEN that she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to buy the materials necessary to make the crafts. She is requesting a loan of 500 PEN with which she will buy wool, cloth, and other products. Her dream for the future is to improve her diet and to live peacefully. What she likes most about her community bank are saving and meeting with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, cloth, and other products

loans.name: Hortencia Trinidad

texts.es: La Señora Hortencia es originaria del municipio de Totonicapán con residencia en la zona uno del mismo municipio, ella inicio su propio negocio en la elaboracion y venta de pan hace mas de quince años ya que es el trabajo de su esposo que se decia a otra actividad profesional ella no quiso que el negocio desapareciera ella necesita de un capital para incrementar su produccion en la compra de arina, levadura, huevos su principal punto de venta todos los dias de la semana en el parque central de Totonicapan desde las seis de la mañana con los ingresos obtenidos ha podido darle educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a native of the town of Totonicapán and resides in Zone 1 of the town. She began her own business of making and selling bread over fifteen years ago. Since this is the work of her husband who now dedicates himself to a different profession and she does not want the business to disappear, Hortencia needs funds to purchase flour, yeast, and eggs in order to increase her production. She sells her bread every day of the week in the central park of Totonicapán starting at six in the morning. With the income she has raised, she has been able to provide for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, and eggs to expand her business

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Iris del Carmen A. T., Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
 De Managua, ella tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y dos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento, Hierro y para terminar de  construir una pared por lo que este se encontraba en mal estado (antes estaba construida de zinc).
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris del Carmen A. T. works as a custodian at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute. Originally from Managua, she has three children in her care and has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. Over this period of time, she has invested three loans into making improvements to her home. Thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL, she is an excellent client. The loan requested would be invested into purchasing construction materials such as: sand, cement, iron, and items to finish building a wall that was in disrepair (it was previously built out of zinc). Her goal is to provide greater security and a higher standard of living for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to, and expand, her house.

loans.name: Tursun's Group

texts.en:
In general, women are considered stronger and more responsible than men are and their attitude to life is stable even in difficulties. Here is a story about one woman, another example of braveness and self–confidence whom everyone really can respect. Not far from Naryn, which is one of beautiful and mountainous towns in Kyrgyzstan, there is a little village, Kochkor, which is famous for its salt. Her name is S. Tursun, a leader of her group. She is a 64-year-old widow. She lost her husband in her early age; however, she has raised two children by herself. Her daughter is 12 and she goes to the local school. Her son is 37. He graduated from the university and now helps his mother fatten and then sell sheep. About 10 years ago after her husband's death she decided to move on, because she could not just give up the future of her children and let the cruel life decide what to do with them. So she bought five sheep to fatten and then to sell. She was successful and continues that business. Now their revenue per month is 5,000 ($113) soms. The life is, of course, better than before and she is planning to expand her business and buy a car in the future. She wants a loan of 5,000 soms. She will use it to buy two another lambs.  

A. Asel is 40 and she is married. She has a daughter who is 11. Her daughter is in fourth grade. Her son who is 10 years old is a smart guy who also studies. He is in third grade. Her husband works as a builder whose salary per month is 5,000 soms. About six years ago, she started a little business where she sells cattle in the local market. They are building a new house, which will be finished in the future. However, they want get a loan to buy four small cattle to breed, because cattle sell well in the market right now. 

A. Elmira is 45 and has a daughter who is 16. Her daughter helps her mother after school. Her husband works as a builder and earns 5,000 soms per month. Seven years ago, A. Elmira began a business. She sells products that are used daily. She started with 25,000 soms and now her profit is 7,000 soms per month. She already increased her turnover and improved her family's well being. With her loan, she wants to buy 100 kg of sugar, different cereals, vegetable oil and daily use goods. 

K. Musa is a 56-year old man whose wife is on a pension. He is going to expand his business by increasing his livestock. He has two children, but they live separately. He resells cattle in the market. He began this business three years ago with 18,000 soms and now he earns 3000 soms. With the loan. he wants to buy a bull to sell.
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two lambs

loans.name: Bertha Dolores

texts.es:
Bertha García de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. 

Bertha desde muy pequeña le gusto hacer peinados, cuando creció decidió que esa iba a ser su profesión. Con un dinero ahorrado obtuvo los materiales para la peluquería empezó ir en casa en casa a dar de sus servicios como peluquera.

Ahora ella tiene su propio local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 haciendo tinturados, cortes de cabello, cepillados, etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la competencia de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar planchas, secadoras, utensilios para su salón de belleza. En el futuro quiere tener otro gabinete.
texts.en:
Bertha G. is 45 years old and lives in a peri-urban zone in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house if made of cement and she counts with only the basic services of electricity and water. Since she was young, Bertha liked styling hair and when she grew older she decided that this would be her profession. With her savings she bought hairdressing materials and she starting going from door-to-door to offer her services as a hairdresser. She now has her own place. She works everyday starting at 8 a.m. dying hair, doing hair cuts, styling hair, etc. One of the difficulties she has is the competition in her neighborhood. With this loan she wants to buy hair straighteners, dryers and utensils for her hair salon. In the future she wants to have another cabinet.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair straighteners, dryers and other hairdressing utensils.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric S. is married and has three children. He has senior high educational background. Eric makes palm kernel oil for sale, he also sells palm fruit and wild meat at Elmina. Eric has been in this business for quite a long time. His wife is a petty trader.  

Eric uses his income to pay his children’s school fees, the family utility bills and cover other expenditures.  Eric will use the loan as additional capital to purchase more palm nuts for sale and also for the preparation of palm kennel oil, and for bush meat for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to save to establish a livestock farm.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase more palm nuts and bush meat for sale

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en:
Mr. Phoem P., 50, and his wife, Mrs. Sros Kong, 48, (pictured together) live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have five children: two sons and three daughters, two of whom are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and the other two have full-time employment.

Phoem has been driving a motorcycle taxi for ten years while his wife runs a grocery store at their house. Phoem is asking for a loan of $500 to repair their house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people who live in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Reth C. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they grow crops to earn some money to support their family.

Although they try to work hard, they earn less income than needed because they do not have enough money to do farming. Thus, in order to improve their crop, Mrs. Reth C. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her growing crop.

Mrs. Reth C. is the mother of six children, one of whom is a babysitter who earns a low salary, another three are enrolled in the local school, while the others are too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her growing crop

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita T. is 45 years old and married with two grown children. She lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband, Rogelio. For almost 12 years, Angelita has been engaged in a dressmaking business. She is hardworking, determined, and dedicated.

Angelita would like to receive a loan to purchase additional materials for her dressmaking, including cotton fabrics and other inventory. She enjoys spending the income from her dressmaking business. Profit from this kind of business is quite good compared to other businesses that Angelita has tried before. That is why she wants this to become more stable and profitable. She has been able to support the needs of her children in school and improve their life.

Angelita has been a very active member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006. She has been a model member demonstrating a 100% credit rating on previous loans – the basis of loans. Angelita’s dreams are for her two children to complete college. Additionally, she hopes to continue the dressmaking business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Mrs. Surn Oum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 17 people who live I. Kab Leav village I. Kandal province. They will all use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Surn O. is the village bank president selected by all the members.
Mrs. Surn O. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also makes thatch to sell, too. Her obstacle is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Surn O. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, and will use the rest of the loan to plow her rice field. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are enrolled I. a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 54 years old, married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Belen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Belen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Belen is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pheoung

texts.en: Pheoung K., 51, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells traditional medicine for an income of USD 3 per day. One of her children is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to transport her medicine to sell. She hopes to use any additional profit to repair the house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport medicine to sell.

loans.name: Hamdia

texts.en:
Hamdia M. prepares kooko (porridge made from millet) for sale with bread at Abura. She has attained a junior-high educational level. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a prison officer.

Hamdia uses her income to support her husband in providing for the general needs of the family. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare more kooko to sell. With the new earnings from her extended business, she plans to invest in the sale of other cereals.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare more kooko to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs like bags of rice, beans and pulses to cook and sell.  Anita is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children and 3 only of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up another restaurant in a different area.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs like bags of rice, beans  and pulses to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sauce condiments, peanut oil, pasta, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma C. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products. She also sells rice by the kilogram in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Erma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Cellestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman with one child who attends a pre-unit class. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to his family needs. She has been operating her business of selling soft drinks (juices) for the last two years. She sells in a shop to her potential customers: the neighboring community and passersby.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a hair drier and cosmetics for her salon. Celestine faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to have a well-furnished salon in the future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get loans to modify her business. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house rent.

loans.use: To purchase a hair drier and cosmetics

loans.name: Balikyewunya Gayaza Womens Group A-Kampala

texts.en:
Needless to say, hard work and constant revamping measures produce profitable results, especially when one is speaking from a business point of view. 

50-year-old N. Christine of Balikyewunya Gayaza women's group in Kampala can relate to the aforementioned statement, given that for the last twenty years she has successfully been presiding over her secondhand clothing sales business in Kampala. She has been able to live within her means from this business for all these years. In a way, being a widow also pushed her to work extra hard, knowing she had to raise school fees for her kids. 

Previously she was more into banana sales. It was a business that did not generate much in terms of profits, but she still managed to survive. Now, however, she wants to rejuvenate her current business with the purchase of more bales of used clothing to resell. In a week she makes about $27, a relatively low figure considering the responsibilities she has.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of clothes for resell

loans.name: Shahnaz Syed Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in the city of Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a housewife who is married to S. R. who is a welder by trade. He operates a welding shop in the nearby market from where he welds different iron items with his welding machine. Currently, he has a single welding machine which has started giving trouble affecting his work so he cannot meet his work deadlines.  He is the only breadwinner of his family and so he puts his best efforts into this work so that he earns a good profit and can meet his family's financial expenses. 
 
Shahnaz has therefore applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s welding business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy a new welding machine and can start doing his work and meet his customers' deadlines. He will not then face financial problems and can successfully continue his work without further difficulties.

Note: In the photo, Shahnaz is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Ngvon

texts.en: Mrs. Ngvon S. is a 35-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a leader in the construction field. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their three children who are attending school. Mrs. Ngvon S. is concerned because her husband is lacking money to purchase more construction equipment for his work. She has not yet saved enough money to support him in his business. To overcome this problem, Mrs. Ngvon S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy tools for her husband to improve his construction business.

loans.use: To buy construction tools for her husband to improve his buisness

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria B. A. tiene la edad de 34 años, vive en el barrio San Ignacio, habita acompañada de su pareja de vida, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que se dedican a estudiar la escuela de primaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 9 años, años en los cuales uno de los principales problemas a los que se han enfrentado ha sido la afectación de los gases emitidos por el volcán que afectan la producción de sus cosechas, fue gracias al apoyo de su papa que logro iniciarse en esta actividad que ha sido el sustento económico de la familia, a futuro espera adquirir un terreno más amplio para multiplicar sus siembras, ella solicita una préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, insumos, e insecticidas que favorezcan las ventas y las condiciones de su familia para óptimos recursos con el objetivo de solventar el gasto económico de los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Rosa Maria B. A., 34, lives in the San Ignacio area.  She lives with her life partner and they have 2 young children, both in elementary school.  Sra. Rosa and her partner have operated a farming busness for 9 years, during which they have faced down a volcano!  They started the farm with help from her father and it is now the main source of income for the family.  However, the gases from the volcano have damaged their fields and lowered their crop yields.  Sra. Rosa is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other supplies so that she can increase her output and, in turn, improve her family's quality of life.  For the future, she wants to buy more land and increase the amount of crops she can grow. Her ultimate goal is to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: Soil treatment plan for farming business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Hardworking mother, these characteristics simply describe Helen Miquel of Pajo, Libertad, Antique, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married to Artus M., a laborer. They are blessed with three children: Yvone Grace, Aira Jane, and Vince Henson.

She has been an active and very good member of ASHI Antique Northwest Branch for almost three years. As a member, she maintains her very good performance because she is aspiring to borrow a larger amount of capital someday.

Helen is a mother who always dreams of a good future for her children and she wants to give the best for them. She dreams that someday all of their children will finish their studies until college. That is why from now on they are starting to save for the future of their children.

For her next loan, she is applying for PHP 24,000. This will be used to purchase a new fishing net so that they will get more fish and therefore have a bigger income. The income that they will be earning from this business will be a great help for them to sustain their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a new fish net

loans.name: María Corona

texts.es: María Corona L. Vda. D. V. D. 65 años D. edad, es una persona que se esfuerza mucho día con día por salir adelante. ResiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente en donD. vive junto a una hija D. 21 años D. edad, la cual le ayuda con el negocio. María se dedica a vender ropa, en el mercado municipal D. San Vicente en donD. es muy conocida y cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, en diferentes tallas y colores, esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder obtener mayor cantidad D. clientes y así percibir más ganancias, lo cual es muy importante para María ya que esta es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuenta para poseer todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en: Maria Corona L. D. V. is 65 years old. She is someone who works hard day after day in order to make ends meet. She lives in the region of San Vicente where she resides with one of her daughters who is 21 years old. She helps her with her business. Maria sells clothing in the municipal market in San Vicente. She is well known and she has various steady clients. She requests a loan in order to purchase greater quantities of clothing in various sizes and colors. This is an effort to capture more clients and increase her earnings. This is very important for Maria because it is the only source of income on which she depends for everything she needs.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. sells smoked fish at Abura. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been in this fish business for 15 years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Aloysuis

texts.en:
Aloysuis was born in 1975; he is happily married to Keimoh Sharon. At the moment he does not have a child. He shares two rooms with his wife in Banja, a quarter in the North West Region of Cameroon.

Aloysuis has had great difficulties in life; the ill health of his parents, and the inability to provide three square meals for himself and his parents  Amongst other challenges, he needs more capital to be able to expand and maintain his business and also take good care of his wife and children to be. With this loan, he plans to buy a new engine, shock absorbers, change the chain, and the battery. This will go a long way to solving the problem of maintenance, which was on a daily basis. This business will help his community by providing them with ready transport means, ease transportation of farm products to market and farm inputs to the farms, considering the poor state of the farm roads.

He will use his profit to repay his loan gradually and also save to buy a plot and construct a house for his family. He will use a fraction of the profit to upgrade his standard of living. He prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy an engine and wheels.

loans.name: Yusett De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yusett De Los Angeles tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y refrescos los días de semana. Hace más de  años que tiene esta actividad pues siempre busca la forma de diversificar su actividad ella tiene 2 hijos y quiere proporcionarles los estudios correspondientes a sus hijos, ya siempre lucha y se esfuerza por ellos. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento como una oportunidad para salir adelante con su actividad. Desea ampliar su negocio lo suficiente para que pueda ser rentable.
texts.en:
Yusett De Los Ángeles is 27 years old.  She sells food and refreshments during the week.   She has had this activity for several years and is always looking for ways to diversify it.  She has two children and wants to provide the corresponding schooling for them; she is always struggling and making an effort for them.

This is why she’s asking for a loan as an opportunity to get ahead in her business.  She wants to expand the business enough to make it profitable.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma.Glenda S. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Canduman, Compostela, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating a general store and an auto repair shop. Her husband Francisco S., who is 30 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living.  They have two children who are 2 and 3 years old. 

Ma.Glenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma.Glenda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,700, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, with which she intends to buy items for the general store to sell to her customers so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. 

Ma.Glenda S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of items for general store

loans.name: Hae-Nna Meleka Group

texts.en:
Roxton F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of four borrowers called Hae-nna Meleka.  He is 42 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 22 years old. Roxton F. was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial constraints. 

Roxton F. has been selling building materials in New Georgia Community, Monrovia, Liberia for 7 years. He plans to use his 15,000 LRD portion of this 60,000 LRD business loan to buy more building materials to resell. Roxton F. describes himself as a God-fearing man whose dreams are to improve his business and to continue educating his children.

loans.use: to buy more building materials to resell

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en:
