She is asking for the loan to buy thread, fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine. With this, she hopes to have more income for her family. She also wants to buy another machine with her income and savings in order to have someone help her when there is a lot of work and orders. At this time, while asking for this loan, she is happy because she has the chance to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products (flour, rice, oil, fish, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

loans.name: Dioclesiano

texts.en:
Dioclesiano is married and has three school-aged children. He is 42 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Dioclesiano is a farmer and grows palay (unhulled rice) to earn a living. He takes good care of his fields. Farming is considered the dominant means of livelihood in this place. He has been cultivating this land for three years. The family also has alternative sources of income and that allows the family to earn PHP 10,000 a month. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm fertilizers to boost production. 

In the future, Dioclesiano hopes to have a good return on investment and farm more land. He dreams of being financially stable and giving a better living situation to his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers to boost production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase radiators and exhaust systems.

loans.name: Alafia A Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Alafia A” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small-town in Western Sierra Leone, near Freetown. “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch in this town specifically to help mothers of school-aged girls. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata.  Fatmata is age 55.  She was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a social worker.  Two of her children are attending primary school and 3 are in secondary school. 

For more than 20 years now, Fatmata has been a businesswoman. She sells palm-oil, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), rice, etc.  With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, gari, rice, etc, at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise used for auto repairs.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a mini-hardware store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has been running the mini-hardware for 11 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. Christina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Lulasi

texts.en:
Lulasi, age 50, earns her living by selling food items in Kator, South Sudan. She has operated her business for ten years.
 
Lulasi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts and breads to offer for sale. She will use the extra income expected from this loan to help pay the school fees of her four children, who are between the ages of five and 20 years old. Three of her children are enrolled in school.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and breads to offer for sale

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Danelia una humilde comerciante de 47 años de edad, casada, se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Cuando ella inicio fue vendiendo dulces que ella misma elaboraba y también vendía toallas , después consiguió un lugar para vender en la acera del Mercado de Granada y justo ahí comenzó a vender mercadería entre ellos juguetes , artículos usados, sabanas. Es muy conocida pues la afluencia de clientes es muy seguida y su peculiar forma de atender a sus cliente y el cariño con que ofrece su mercadería la hace muy solicitada. Además ella tiene una mini pulpería  
En su casa de habitación ya que son parte de su segundo ingresos aunque la falta de productos que ofrecer no le ha permito crecer a su mini pulpería. Es por ello que realizo el crédito para compra de granos básico, sopas, pan , dulces, galletas, productos de limpieza, aceite, frijoles. Pues necesita ofrecer estos productos para poder ofrecer calidad y mejorar los ingresos de su negocio. Una de sus expectativas es establecer  un tramo con buenas condiciones ya que es donde esta actualmente es al aire libre y no cuenta con seguridad.
texts.en:
Danelia is a humble merchant, 47 years old and married, who sells general merchandise. When she began, she sold sweets that she made herself, as well as towels. Later, she secured a place to sell in the area near the Market of Grenada. That's where she began selling other merchandise, such as toys, used items, and sheets. She's very well known so her customers' support is continuous. Her unique way of waiting on her customers and the care with which she sells her merchandise leaves her very sought after. 

In addition, she has a small corner store in her house, which makes up part of her secondary income, though a lack of products to offer has kept her from growing her store. Therefore, she needs this loan to buy basic grains, soups, bread, sweets, crackers, cleaning products, oils, and beans so that she can 
offer quality merchandise and increase the revenues of her business. 

One of her ambitions is to establish a better quality site of her own, as she currently sells in the open air with no guarantee of safety.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, bread, sweets, crackers, cleaning products, oils, and beans.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 52 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Manuel está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de maíz, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Jose aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 

Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.

Manuel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 52-year-old man who lives with his family in a community in the southern zone of Costa Rica, in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural and livestock production, particularly the growing of tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and livestock raising.

Manuel is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones so that he can care for his crops, buying fertilizer and fungicide to protect his corn seed crops as it is a reliable and sustainable choice.  With these fertilizers, Manuel will increase the soil's capacity to absorb different nutritional elements.  He will use the fungicides to avoid fungus appearing on his plantations so that his customers will not risk ingesting them and becoming ill.

In this way, Manuel will provide good-quality produce to his customers.  He will reach the sales goal that he has set out for each month.  He will also be able to meet his obligations and payments so that he can provide for his large family.

Manuel is a member of the Danta community loan company, one of 150 community loan companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides for growing corn

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en:
Israfil is a 27 year old young man and is married with one daughter. Israfil is IDP. He has been raising fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. His father taught him the best experience in raising crops. 

Israfil usually sells his crop in the central market. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in an Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.

Israfil would like to increase the number of products he sells and for this purpose he applied for 600 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rosario

texts.es:
Carmen es una microempresaria que hecha y vende tortillas en su casa de habitación desde hace cinco años.

Tiene dos trabajadoras en el negocio quienes les paga su salario generando empleo a dos cabezas de familias, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, cal, etc.
texts.en:
Carmen has run a small business making and selling tortillas in her house for the past five years. She employs two female workers, thus providing an income for two heads of households.

The money from the loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, lime etc.

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, lime etc.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en: Ravshan is widowed. She is careful mother of 3 children. Ravshan has been busy with sewing more than 12 years. Her business is the only source of her family income. Ravshan sews Tajik national women dresses. She has regular customers thanks to the good service. Ravshan always tries for education of her children. Her son is a student. Ravshan must to pay for his tuition but she has not enough money. Ravshan is asking for a loan to pay for tuition of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition of her son

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria M. M. is a single mother. She has a small coffee shop inside an elementary school here in Nuevo Laredo. Her menu is tacos, burritos, corn, juice, soda and some snacks, and she sells her food to the students at lunch time. She wants to incorporate more healthy food for the students instead of only snacks, and this is why she is applying for a loan of $900. With this money she will buy more ingredients to make healthy snacks and give a better option to the students and this will also increase her family income.

Español

La Sra. Candelaria Martínez Martínez es Madre soltera y tiene una pequeña tiendita en una escuela primaria de Nuevo Laredo en la cual les vende alimentos a los estudiantes (como tacos, lonches, fritos, elotes, refrescos, jugos y etc.) en la hora de recreo. Ella quiere elaborar comida más saludable para los estudiantes de la escuela y con esto generar un mejor ingreso para su familia, incrementando sus ventas y dando mejores opciones de alimentación a los estudiantes, por ello solicita un préstamo de $900.00 con los cuales pretende comprar los ingredientes para su proyecto. Este crédito piensa pagarlo en un año y generar un mejor ingreso familiar.

loans.use: healthy food

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif is an IDP from occupied Khodjali district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. Married, has three children. He started his business in 2002, and borrowed two Normicro loans from Baku branch totalling $1350. Now he would like to borrow $850.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa F. is 41 years old. She owns her own home in Alpacoma on the outskirts of La Paz where she lives with her husband Jose Vargas and their six children, four of them minors. She sells groceries from a kiosk in El Alto. She would like to build a wall around her three-room home. This loan will pay to remove soil from the yard and build a wall around it. This is her second construction loan from IMPRO. Their first-class record with IMPRO shows them to be good borrowers, capable of making monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Teresa Fernández tiene 41 años, vive en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona Alpacoma a las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a su esposo, el señor José Vargas y sus seis hijos, de los cuales cuatro aun son menores de edad, realiza compra y venta de abarrotes en un quiosco ( puesto de venta en la calle) en la ciudad de El Alto. La vivienda de la señora Teresa Fernández cuenta con tres habitaciones, pero no tiene amurallado. El crédito solicitado será para la construcción de un muro de contención y remoción de tierra del patio en una primera fase. Esta es la segunda vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito para construcción (la anterior fue para terminar de construir una habitación). Su historial en nuestra institución los clasifica como clientes 1 al ser puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales lo que le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs Som S. is 31 years old. She works as a laundress. Her husband is a construction foreman. They have 5 children and their combined revenue is around 6 dollars per day. She has applied for a loan to purchase tools to repair their home.

loans.use: To purchase tools to repair her home

loans.name: Ahovi Christine

texts.fr:
Aged 37, Mrs. Ahovi Christine A. is married and has five children. Abandoning her studies during high school, she started selling fruit and plantain banana fritters. Due to lack of funds, she can no longer sell fruit and now just sells fritters. But there is virtually no profit in these. Worried about her living conditions and those of her family, she is asking for a loan of $600 to be able to start up the fruit business again, which is very profitable.

Agée de 37 ans, Madame A. Ahovi Christine est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Abandonnant ses études au cours secondaire, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des fruits et des beignets de bananes plantains. Par manque de moyens, elle n’arrive plus à faire le commerce de fruit et se contente de celui des beignets. Mais les revenus n’existent presque pas sur ce dernier. Soucieuse de sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir reprendre le commerce de fruit qui est très rentable.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling fruit

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 42 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells foodstuff and has been in this business since 1992. She has been a LAPO client for the past 2 years. She is requesting a $250 loan, which she will repay within 8 months.  She will be use to buy more foodstuff for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a mother of seven children, three boys and four girls. I live in a small rented house with my husband and children. My husband is a daily wage laborer, I make thread reels and my eldest son makes electric heaters. Winter is around the corner and heaters will be high in demand. We want to expand our business and produce a high quantity of heaters.  We request a loan of $250 to buy the materials required to manufacture these heaters in bulk. We hope to generate higher profits this year, which we will save to marry one of our daughters.

loans.use: To expand heater business

loans.name: Rofelio

texts.es:
Rofelio is a hard working man who has worked for 18 years in agricultural activities. Everyday he wakes up early to go to the fields to pasture his livestock. He works carefully, caring for every details fo the animals' feeding. He learned this from her father an mother, who also work caring for livestock. Now as a responsible father, Rofelio works with his four children in mind, hoping to give them security and well being. Rofelio is familiar with the hard times that can bring need, and for that reason, he takes advantage of every day to see that his loved ones do not have problems. His next goal is to increase the number of livestock which he has in order to use them to raise his family's quality of life. We ask you to support this loving father so that he can continue on the road to success.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Rofelio, es muy trabajador y empeñoso es por ello que ya lleva 18 años dedicándose a las actividades agrícolas, cada día se levanta muy temprano para ir al campo a pastar su ganado, se dedica con tanto empeño que cuida cada detalle en su alimentación, esto lo aprendió de su padre y su madre que también son ganaderos y hoy por hoy como padre responsable asume sus roles pensando en sus cuatro hijos con el objetivo de brindarles seguridad y bienestar.Rofelio, es conocedor de las situaciones difíciles que ocasionan necesidades y es por ello que día a día se esfuerza al máximo a fin de que los suyos se desenvuelvas sin problemas. Su próxima meta es incrementar la cantidad de animales para acrecentar con ellos su nivel de vida familiar.Posibilitemos su petición para que este amoroso padre continúe por el camino del éxito.

loans.use: Purchase additional and greater variety of livestock

loans.name: Masanda D(Ii) Group

texts.en: Edith is 23 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a mechanic. She sells used clothes for a living. Edith wants to use the extra business profits to re-invest in her clothes business. Agnes has a stone quarry business, while Christine is a poultry farmer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Jayanti K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, which is located in Lalitpur district of Nepal. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. K. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband, and her sons. Her sons are studying in grade 7 and 3, respectively.

Mrs. K. and her husband, Mr. Bishnu K., started their poultry farm five years ago. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law also help them in their work. They used to sell their chickens in the local market. Now Mrs. K. is requesting her second loan of Rs15000.00 to buy small chickens.

loans.use: To buy small chickens for her farm

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: O. Joy is married with 3 children. She is 25 years old and has been in business since 2005. She is from Edo State Nigeria and sells fruits. She needs the loan of $350 to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy pawpaw and pineapple for sale

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Bùi Thị Vân, 34, participates in TYM fund since 1998. She is married and has 2 school aged children. Her main occupation is buying/collecting waste material to resell to recycling companies. This is very hard work physically. Everyday she has to cycle long distance to collect/buy the waste material from the people. At the end of the day, she has to sort it into different categories to sell to the recycling companies. She makes 3-5 USD a day, this provides her with cash flow to cover the everyday expenses and the weekly payment toward the loan. This time she is seeking a loan of 450 USD so that she would be able to buy a lot more waste material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Vân, 34 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. Chị Vân đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chính hiện nay của chị là thu mua phế liệu. Đây là một công việc vất vả, hàng ngày chị phải đạp xe đi hàng chục km thu mua hàng. Cuối ngày chị phân loại và bán lại cho các cơ sở sản xuất và tái chế nguyên liệu. Nhờ chịu khó nên mỗi ngày chị Vân kiếm được khoảng 3-5USD. Thu nhập thường xuyên giúp chị chi trả những chi phí sinh hoạt hàng ngày và tiền tuần. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD để có thể thu mua được nhiều phế liệu hơn.

loans.use: Buy wasted materials

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran B., wife of M., is a mother of two sons. She successfully repaid a previous loan which she used to purchase a sewing machine and stitch clothes for neighbors. Her daily income is three to five dollars. Her husband is a trader by profession. She would like a second loan for her husband to expand his trading business.

The other members of the group have various needs for the loan. Zahooran B. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Nargis B. wants the money to change the body of auto rickshaw. Sajida B. wants a loan to start a dental clinic and Nargis B. wants a loan to expand her clinic.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand businesses, repair a rickshaw and purchase a donkey cart.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la fabricacion de fritas de yuca-elote con azucar, tengo varios años haciendo este trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el suentento de mi famila, en estos momentos tengo contratadas dos mujeres para la reparticion de mi producto, pero necesito tener mayor produccion ya que las ventas se han ido arriba y no me doy abasto con las necesidas de mis clientes, por lo tanto solicito su apoyo para poder comprar mas materia prima y tener una produccion mayor, con parte de las ganancias que obtenga deseo seguir ayudando a mi nieto que esta en la escuela.

loans.use: compra de yuca, manteca, sal, aceite, leña, fosforos, azucar, elotes

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Mrs. Lean L., 58, is a grocery seller in Chub Village, Siem Reap Province. She earns around $2 per day. Her husband, 70, is a construction worker as well as driving a car taxi and he earns around $3 per day. Together they have one child who is a still young and in school. In order to expand her business and increase their income, Mrs. Lean L. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more grocery products to sell. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase gas to sell. The loan will allow her to expand her grocery selling business and improve the family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and gas to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Duch Sokheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank which is located in Boeng Krum Leu Village in Kandal Province consists of twelve people. Mrs. Duch S. is the village bank president. She was born in 1966 and she now lives in the village mentioned. She is a pig breeder who is raising twelve pigs.

Since her pigs are now growing bigger and bigger, Mrs. Duch S. faces a problem because she does not have enough money for pig feed to support them. Thus, Mrs. Duch S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Keth Nai, is a policeman who can make KHR 12, 5000 (US$ 32) to support his family. Mrs. Duch S. has five children, one of whom is 20 years old and he is a policeman who can make the same salaR. as his father. The remaining four are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Charly Smith

texts.es:
Charly  tiene 21 años. Hace dos  años empezó su negocio de zapatería, al cual le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo.
El empeño que pone en su trabajo se lo debe al nacimiento de su hija, la cual apenas tiene dos meses de nacida.

El último crédito que recibo Charly le sirvió para comprar materiales para su zapatería, como suelas y pegamento. 
Además, él cuenta que necesita hacer crecer su negocio, ya que con los ingresos que tiene muchas veces no le alcanza para mantener a su hija recién nacida.
texts.en:
Charly is 21 years old. Two years ago, he opened his own shoe repair shop, to which he devotes most of his time. All the effort that he puts in his work is due to the birth of his daughter, who is only two months old. The last loan that Charly received was used to purchase materials, such as soles and glue, for his shoe repair shop. Furthermore, he needs to make his business grow because often times he does not earn enough income to support his newborn daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in materials for shoe repair shop

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La  señora Olga C., trabaja con nuestra institución desD. el 15 D. mayo  D. este año y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado gran responsabilidad. Tiene como actividad principal un puesto D. venta al detalle en una D. las calles más populares D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia. Vive en una casa propia, que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos D. sanidad y con ella viven sus dos pequeños niños, uno D. 9 años y otro D. 12 años, sin embargo, en las que viven no son tan cómodas debido a que trabaja D. lunes a domingo. Es viuda desD. hace tres años, por ello su trabajo es la única fuente D. ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Olga C. started working with our institution on May 15th of this year. During this time, she has demonstrated great responsability. Her main job is a stand which she services located in one of the most popular streets in the City of La Paz, Bolivia. She owns her home and her 2 sons live with her. One who is 9 years old and the other is 12 years old. She hardly sees her kids because she works everyday from Monday thru Sunday. She's been a widower for over 3 years. Her job is the only source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun S. is a villager in Trapeang Sragei village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand her business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Chhem Kim, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn his living. Mrs. Choeun S. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Sidonie

texts.fr: Née vers 1968 à  HÊTIN DOGODO  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame H. Sidonie est mariée et mère de 3enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GF DJIDJOHO DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du riz. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 120 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1968 in Hetin Dogodo, in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Sidonie H. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Djidjoho of Hetin Sota, situated near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells rice.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Sidonie H. has requested a loan of 120,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Fouvale

texts.en: Fouvale F., 25, is married with 1 child. She has 2 years of experience in a uniform, t-shirt and puletasi business. She sells to the village people, public and families 3 days per week. She is a new member, with just one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala. SPBD loans are Fouvale’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is forty years old. She is a single parent and has two children. They are both in school. She is a food vendor and sells “kenkey”. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish or soup. She has many customers because kenkey is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. Florence sells on the street in the mornings and evenings. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise her income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and fish

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. sells food supplies like plantain, banana and other items at Atobiase, near Elmina. Mercy has received primary level education.  She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter. Mercy has been selling food supplies like plantain and bananas since 2007. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the house keeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house that she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. is a doctor. Her main activity has been the provision of medical services for more than 15 years. Elena works in the hospital district and in the afternoon hours she works at home. She has a room that needs repair, according to sanitary requirements.

Elena is requesting a loan to purchase new equipment. She serves 10-12 clients daily. Elena has a profitable business because she does not spend much, only for water and electricity.

loans.use: purchasing new equipment

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike C. O. is 45 years old and married with three children. He lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. 

He produces and sells palm oil in wholesale and retail. He needs the loan amount of US$1,025 (N150,000) to purchase more palm nuts for the production of palm oil to sell. The demands for his palm oil are high, and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. 

He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm nuts for the production of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Maoti

texts.en: Maoti T., 45, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has  previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Maoti’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase boxes of chicken, oil, onions, garlic, soya, rice; box of lamp flaps, sausages, foam plates and foil

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.en:
Tình Dương Thị  (538991077) is a 40 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tình owns and operates a service business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from the rental of general equipment to local community members. Tình has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3300000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, Tình joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tình successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that she used to expand her business. Tình is now requesting a loan of 10000000 VND which she will again invest in expanding her business. This will be T.'s 10th loan from TYM Fund. Tình plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in and expand her business.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 46 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Bilal has been selling chocolate and he also does chocolate design. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to start a new business selling ice cream. This is the first time that Bilal has requested a loan.
Bilal is special in his work because he does nice designs. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by selling ice cream.

loans.use: Bilal will use the loan to start a new business selling ice cream.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: Thierno  D.  gère une unité de transformation de céréale  dans son village de Sandiara situé à 80 km de la capitale sénégalaise Dakar. Son unité de transformation compte trois moulins à mil. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de nourrir sa famille et d’aider ses parents. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il veut acheter une machine de transformation de patte d’arachide pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Thierno D. processes cereals in his village of Sandiara, situated 80 km from the Senegalese capital, Dakar. He has three mills that process millet. The income from this activity permits him to support his family and help his parents. With the requested loan, he wants to buy a machine to process peanuts to make peanut butter to increase his income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a machine to make peanut butter

loans.name: Sakina Maqbool Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Sakina, and I have lived in Arifwala, Pakistan, for 15 years. I own a two-room brick house in which I live with my family: my husband and my two children. My husband's name is M. H.. He runs a dairy business. Actually, he buys milk from the milk men and sells the milk to the community. This work requires a struggle and the profits are small. Therefore, we decided to buy a buffalo so we could sell our own milk to the milk shops.  

I am the group leader of two other women from my locality. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
 
Note: Sakina baji is seated on the right.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Klugbo

texts.fr: Klugbo J. est une jeune femme de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle tient une baraque sur laquelle elle étale divers articles. J. souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en louant un magasin et l’approvisionner. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour sauver sa famille de la misère.
texts.en:
Klugbo Jeanna is a married young woman, 34 years old, with 2 children. She has a stall where she displays and sells various items. With this loan, J. hopes to increase the size of her business by renting out a store and supplying it. She is counting on this opportunity to rescue her family from poverty.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent out a store and supply it

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 25-year-old married woman who has two children ages 4 and 6 years old. All of her children go to school. She owns and lives in a four-room house with five people. Lydia doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area.

Lydia owns a dry cleaning shop and a video library in one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transportation to go shopping. Lydia sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family. She has been in this business for five years. 

Lydia has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her ninth loan with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more video tapes and buy another flat iron. Lydia wants to see her business grow bigger and she dreams of owning a house on the land that she bought with her business profits.
 

.

loans.use: To buy more video tapes, soap  and a flat iron

loans.name: Grupo Panyevar1 Group

texts.es: El grupo de panyevar a estado trabajando unos 7 años atras siempre con la mentalidad de superar ya que en el area de Santa clara, hay mucha pobreza y las mujeres han luchado par salir avante y teniendo en mente sobre salir con los hijos y darles estudios y brindarles el apoyo ya que ellas relatan que no tubieron esa posibilidad para estudiar, han venido a la asociaciòn ASDIR para pedir ese apoyo que ellas tanto lo necesitan para incrementar  sus ventas y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida ya que le es necesario ofrecer otros productos de ropa tipica pero no cuenta con el capital necesario, las mujeres se han unido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Panyevar group has been working together for seven years. They always have in mind that they want to overcome, as there is a lot of poverty in the Santa Clara area. The women have fought to get ahead, keeping in mind that they want their children to get ahead. They want to support their children and give them an education, which is a possibility that they never had. They have come to the ASDIR Association to ask for this much needed support to increase their sales. This way they will have better living conditions. They need to offer products other than typical clothing, but they do not have the necessary money. The women have united to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y vive con su única hija de 17 años, quien viene estudiando una carrera técnica. Ella implementó en su casa una pequeña bodega, donde vende productos comestibles básicos (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc), además de bebidas. En esta actividad lleva un periodo de 9 años, atendiendo todos los días, durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que mediante éste se relaciona con muchas personas y gana muchos clientes debido a su buena atención, además se siente útil. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable, pues es la única tienda de su zona. Adicionalmente, desde hace 6 años, también vende productos de belleza. Para el futuro, Adela quiere construir un local para un minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos con sus compras diarias, ya que su zona está muy alejada D. mercado.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes se apoyan entre sí. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y así implementará su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Adela, 45, is a single mother. She lives with her only daughter, 17, who is studying for a technical career. She set up a small store in her house where she sells basic foods (eggs, noodles, rice, milk, and bread, etc.) and drinks. She has been doing this for a period of nine months. She works in the store all day every day. What she likes about the business is that through the business she gets to connect with a lot of people, and she wins many customers due to her good attention. Also, she feels useful. Being the only store in the region, it is very profitable. She has also been selling beauty products for the past six months. In the future Adela would like to build a place for a mini market, which would help her neighbors with their daily purchases. Her region is very far from the market. This is her second loan with MFP. What she likes most about working with her communal bank is that all of the members support each other. She will use the money she is asking for to buy basic needs items and adequately stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena G. is a 31-year-old single parent living in Barangay Talab-an, a part of Manapla Municipality in Negros Occidental Province. She is not married because her fiancé became sick and died before their wedding, leaving her pregnant with their baby. Even though she must support her five-year-old daughter alone, she is determined to provide a good future for her child.

Left alone to fend for her baby girl, Gena decided to establish her own business with the help of start-up capital from her mother so that she could support her young daughter and herself. As she moved on with her life, the pain of losing her child's father lessened, especially as she busied herself with building her general store and raising her daughter.

As her business slowly grew, Gena saw new opportunities for expansion. In 2006 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could add to her capital and expand her business. The loans she received from NWTF-Project Dungganon enabled her to diversify into food vending, including selling frozen food in her general store. The business now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP, which she uses for household expenses and in savings for her daughter's future. The rest she plows back into the business.

In her eighth loan cycle she borrowed 19,500 PHP to add to her revolving working capital. She was able to pay back the weekly installments on time and in full within the loan term. Now Gena is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP for her ninth cycle. With it she intends to increase her inventory a little more so that she can build her savings for the future security of her small family.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her general store

loans.name: Lemalyn

texts.en:
Lemalyn J. is asking from KIVA lenders the amount of Php 6,000 to purchase more items of personal collection cosmetics products. She has about two years from her business. Lemalyn is 32 years old married to Jimmy J.. They are gifted with three children and all are sending in school to take their studies. Even she is pregnant and about to deliver her baby soon, she is looking for her costumers around their village to have income and savings for her future emergencies.  

Her husband is busy in working with their field activities. Their yield could not able to sustain her children expenditures in school when she is delivering her baby. She needs additional capital to purchase her costumers order in her business products.

loans.use: additional capital for buying more products to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita I. is 63 years old from Lila, Bohol.  She sells dried fish and has a sari-sari (variety) store.  Her business helps her a lot in everyday living. Now she’s renovating her store for improvement.  She needs additional capital to finance her business.  Conchita is requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for Php 8,000.  This will help sustain her business and improve her status in life.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Nonina

texts.en:
Nonina is 44 years old and serves as the father and mother to her two children: John Lexter - 19 years old, and Anjanette - 17 years old, both in college.

Nonina manages a sari-sari store business (community based store) in her village of Rizal, Santiago City. Aside from her retailing business, she also manages their fishpond.

Nonina would like to improve her fish pond and buy additional groceries for her store. Therefore, she is now asking to borrow PHP 10,000 to pursue her business plans. This amount could really help her, most especially in providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store and to improve her fishpond

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Esther is starting a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products to the local community.

In 2009, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Esther is requesting a 2nd loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años, es una joven mujer que vive al lado de su pareja y sus 4 hijos: Jocelyn de 15, Caroline de 12, Alex de 9 y Ken de 6 añitos de edad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio, es decir, recibe pedidos de sus vecinas, amigas y familiares, y posteriormente pasa a repartir las prendas a sus domicilios, obteniendo así los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. 
María viene realizando esta labor por 6 años y se siente muy feliz, ya que su trabajo la hace sentir independiente; además, le permite dedicarse a su hogar, por lo que está muy cómoda realizándolo. 
María ha pensado en el futuro, y le gustaría tener un puesto en un mercado muy concurrido para así poder tener mayor estabilidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy responsable con todos los compromisos que asume, es por ello que se compromete en no fallar con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is a 34 year old young woman. She lives by the side of her life partner and their four children; Jocelyn, 15; Caroline, 12; Alex, 9; and Ken, 6. She sells clothes to homes. That is to say, she gets orders from her neighbors, friends, and relatives. Later she delivers the clothing to their homes. That is how she gets the necessary income to support her family. María has been doing this work for six years. She is very happy because the work makes her feel independent. Also, it allows her to work on her home, which she is very comfortable doing. María has thought about the future, and she would like to have a very popular stand in the market. That way she would be able to have greater stability. This is her first loan with MFP. She has always been very responsible with all of her commitments. She promises not to miss any of her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a larger quantity of clothes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years-old and married. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling basic commodities.  She has been engaged in her business for almost seven years and earns approximately 8,000 a month.

In 2008, she joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access for financial services and to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 from PMPC.  She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 which will be use to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Juana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: additional capital of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D. is from the city of Maloro Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline operates a family member's service-based business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide esthetic services.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JUAN, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, El socio vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestro socio tiene 48 años de edad, El es casado con la socia Alejandrina, nuestro socio es de oficio taxista, pero también siempre que puede ayuda a su esposa a vender o a comprar los ingredientes para que ella elabore los panes, nuestro socio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo viven con ellos 3 de 25,23,19 años de edad, nuestro socio está solicitando el préstamo para poder ayudar a comprar a su esposa harina, manteca, levadura entre otros ingredientes, para así continuar con el negocio familiar.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the “Ricchary Purisun - Oropesa” community bank and lives in the district of Oropesa within the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the city. He is 48 years old and married to another member of the community bank, Alejandrina. Juan is a taxi driver, but he always helps out his wife when he can by buying ingredients for her to make bread or selling the product. Juan has five children, three of whom, ages 25, 23 and 19, live with him. He is requesting a loan to help buy flour, lard, yeast and other ingredients for his wife so they can continue the family business. Juan is grateful and values the opportunity made available through this medium, and thus promises to fulfill his payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his wife's bakery

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. José Antonio G. Hernández trabaja para el área de jardinería en un centro turísticos, opera una podadora de césped manual, su estado civil es casado, este crédito lo solicito  para terminar de construir su vivienda, con CEPRODEL es su cuarto crédito y dice sentirse bien con los beneficios que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
José Antonio G. Hernández works as a gardener in tourist centers; he operates a manual lawn mower. He is married and is asking for funding to finish building his house. This is his 4th loan with CEPRODEL and he says he's happy with the benefits that the institution offers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su padre y hermanos en el distrito de La Unión, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha (bebida típica del país) desde hace cinco años. El nos comenta que aprendió la elaboración de esta bebida de sus padres ya que los apoyaba en su negocio cuando era menor de edad, ahora el ya prepara su propia chicha y la vende a sus propios clientes, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en apoyar a la economía de su familia.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, esta elaborada  base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que vive en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su productos, especialmente de leña y carbon (la chicha se prepara en cocinas de leña y carbon), ya que debido a la temporada de lluvias, propia del verano, el carbón y la leña se vuelven escasos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Jose es un joven bastante trabajador y optimista. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y apoyar a sus padres cuando lo necesiten.
texts.en:
José, age 25, is single and lives with his father and brothers in the La Unión district, Piura Province, in the Piura region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For five years, he has been engaged in the making and sale of chicha (a traditional drink of Peru). He tells us that he learned how to make this drink from his parents since he helped them with this business when he was young. Now, he is preparing his own chicha and selling it to his own customers. He uses the income that he gets from this business for his personal expenses and to support his family.

Chicha is a traditional drink of the entire country. It is made from a variety of corn and a great deal is consumed by people who live in rural areas since it gives them energy needed to continue working.

José wants to expand his business by purchasing raw materials used to make his product, especially firewood and charcoal (chicha is prepared in kitchens using firewood and charcoal) since, due to the spring rainy season, charcoal and firewood have become scarce. This is why he is applying for the first time for a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He wants to use the loan to reach his objective. José is a very hard working and optimistic young man. His greatest wishes are to continue growing as a businessman and to support his parents when they need him.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials for making chicha

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema A. is a married woman who runs a small business. She sells soft drinks and snacks at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the soft drinks from her suppliers and she prepares the snacks herself. She buys items needed for her business from retail shops. She has recently managed to add a new endeavor to her business, selling clothes, and she has employed one staff person to help her. 

She needs a loan of T.shs 1,500,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, her oldest a 17-year-old student. She dreams of her children finishing college and having a bright future. Leonila has a small sari-sari store at her house in Trinidad, Bohol and also dries fish that she sells at her store and sometimes in the market. She hopes to earn better to sustain her children’s education.  Leonila is now applying for a loan of Php 2,000 to purchase additional stocks for her store and also fresh fish that she can dry and sell.

loans.use: Additional store inventory

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. prepares tea and fried eggs with bread for sale at Abura. (It is like breakfast in the evening; she prepares it for those who wish to take in light food in the evening.) At the time the picture was taken it wasn’t time for her to start working.  

Esi has junior high educational background.  She is a single parent. She is responsible for educating her child and paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more Milo (a cocoa drink), sugar, eggs, coffee and other ingredients for her food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop to sell in.

loans.use: buy more Milo, sugar, eggs, coffee and other items to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita R., 57, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that she and her two children can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Margarita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish and maintain her product inventory and continue operations of her variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful, providing her and her children a comfortable and well-off future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries needed to continue operations of her variety store

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita P. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Anecita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from processing and selling charcoal and wood-related products in the local community. Anecita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Anecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anecita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anecita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en: C. Nghiêm Thị (20206010006) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh, Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of this seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02). C. is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month. C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her first from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị T. (20206010007) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị Bé (20206010008) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Trần Thị T. (20206010009) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 4. Kiều Thị D. (20206010010) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her handicrafts business. 5. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206010011) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 6. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206010012) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** C. Nghiêm Thị (20206010006) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở T. phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các T. viên. Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên C. thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập C. của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa pH.. C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND. C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài C. giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị T. (20206010007) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị Bé (20206010008) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Trần Thị T. (20206010009) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 4. Kiều Thị D. (20206010010) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật. Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. 5. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206010011) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 6. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206010012) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài C. vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & C. xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anne Sènoumè

texts.fr: A. Anne Sènoumè est née le 26 Juillet 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SETIN Noël, Anne Sènoumè est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Anne Sènoumè vit avec sa famille à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis quinze ans environs. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges familiales. Anne Sènoumè a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Anne Sènoumè prépare et vend de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Anne Sènoumè vend du pétrole à son domicile. Anne Sènoumè fait ses provisions à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique de renforcer son capital et d'augmenter le volume de sa production alimentaire, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne Sènoumè sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Anne Sènoumè was born on July 26, 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Mr. SETIN Noël, she is the mother of four children who are all in school.  She has lived with her family in Djeffa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for about fifteen years.  The couple jointly cover their family's difference expenses.  Anne has had very little schooling.  For about ten years, she has been making and selling akassa (a local food made with corn starch) at her home.  Secondarily, she sell kerosene out of her home.  She gets her provisions at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is a previous client of ALIDé having already had five loans, which were all repaid.  With regard to bolstering her food production and satisfying her customers further, Anne is requesting another loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and some kerosene

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Esther; ella tiene 30 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo , ella vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand de venta de panes ella vende panes en el paradero de Urcos todos los días se le encuentra allá desde las 6 a.m; ella espera a que pasen los buses con destino a diferentes ciudades y cuando hacen su parada aquí en este punto ella les ofrece sus panes calientitos para el viaje.  La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar panes, canasta nueva, silla.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank. The member lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Esther is the member. She is 30 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has one child. She lives in the Urcos district, and she is a small businesswoman. She has a stand where she sells bread. She sells at the bus stops in Urcos. She is there everyday starting at 6:00 a.m. She waits for the busses going to different cities. When they make their stop where she is waiting, she offers her warm bread for the trip. The member is requesting a loan to buy bread, a new basket, and a chair. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. This allows her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, a new basket, and a chair

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 51 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been engaged in farming for over 25 years. Right now, she also manages a sari-sari store she was able to put up from her income from farming. She says she hopes to expand her store.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer and also additional store inventory. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Teresita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and financially support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizer and also additional store inventory

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter belongs to a small city called Borewala, which is located in Pakistan's Punjab province. She doesn’t have any children. She spends her time making artificial flowers to support her husband financially. She sells the flowers at a good rate to different gift shops. Her husband runs a sweetmeat and bakery shop in the market. His business is going along nicely, and Shamim is living a satisfactory financial life. Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her nephew, who started his sweetmeat shop a few years ago. With the loan he will buy the required items for his sweetmeat shop, such as milk, sugar, dried fruit, and flavored essence.

Shamim is very supportive and loves to help people in need. She is very hopeful that her nephew will be able to improve his business with the help of this investment. Shamim has been a regular loan user of Asasah for the last two years and has proved herself a responsible person.

loans.use: To purchase required items for a sweetmeat shop

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em V. is married and lives with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples.

V. buys used motorbikes to resell for an income of USD 8 per day. He is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a used motorbike to resell. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.

This is V.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to resell

loans.name: Esinyen Lopulumoe

texts.en:
Esinyen Lopulumoe L. is a 31-year-old man married to Anna Amana. They have three children, aged 9, 5 and 2 respectively. They live in Mwanyaka, 1 kilometer from Eldoret town. Esinyen sells charcoal and also repairs bicycles, which is how he earns his income. He has been in this business for the past 10 years with an income of 9,800 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month.

Esinyen was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs.5,000. With this loan, he plans to purchase charcoal and bicycles spare parts.

He hopes that with the income he is going to make, he will purchase a piece of land

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and bicycles spare parts

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie has been operating a computer shop for three years now. Aside from that, he also tills a rice farm and his wife also helps him with a hog-raising business. They have a 2-year-old son. His family lives in Surallah, South Cotabato. 

Thinking ahead, he dreams to maximize his profit in these businesses. He applied for a loan in order to purchase farm inputs and increase the number of hogs that he is currently raising. He wants to buy additional piglets and stocks of pig feed. This way, if he can save enough profits, he can use it to reinvest in other business opportunities. Any income generated will be used for his son’s future education and investment in other business options.

loans.use: Farm supplies and additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien T. N. is 53 years old with four children, two of whom are attending college. She is a farmer who goes to the field every day to tend to her 2,500 square meter rice paddy where she also grows eggplant. Additionally, Tien raises 200 chickens to provide eggs for sale. Her monthly income of 3,500,000 VND does not cover big monthly expenditures. Tien wants to expand her egg business by adding 100 more hens. She is therefore requesting a 7,630,000 VND loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hens and expand her business

loans.name: Joko C. R.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the Russell Technical Secondary School, in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in 2006 by Joko C.R. V., to cater for under-privileged youths in the community. Currently, the school is staffed with twenty-three teachers and has an enrollment of 545 pupils.   

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 7,400,000.
