With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone can not do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials; some buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while others will invest the loan in business. 

Joko C.R. V. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in a village called Rotifunk, Joko is today residing in Waterloo together with his wife and five children. His wife is a businesswoman and three of his children are attending primary and secondary schools. Mr. V., who has served in the teaching profession for thirty years, would like to use his share of this loan to buy house-building materials in order to complete his house-building project.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Hipolinaria

texts.es:
Hipolinaria  es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con seis hijos, tiene grado D. instrucción D. primero D. secundaria.
Hipolinaria viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. aquellos años que era la compra y venta D. ovejas, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en la Región Tacna.  
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital  D. su negocio.
Su sueño es progresar y seguir adelante en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Hipolinaria is a member of the “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” community bank which is located in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 56 years old, married and has six children.  She completed the first year of her secondary education.

Hipolinaria has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business which, back then, was buying and selling sheep.  She currently works selling groceries in Tacna region.

She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to make progress and succeed in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank are the talks.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Salaam

texts.en:
Salaam A. is a 53-year-old lady from Mlaleo. She is divorced and a mother of four children. She is a tailor by profession and she has been in the tailoring business for the last 23 years. 

This is her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. She plans to purchase materials in readiness for orders from her clients in the area, especially in the festive season. She will use the anticipated profits to renovate her rental houses.

Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase material (fabric) to use for her orders

loans.name: Prescilla's Group

texts.en:
Prescilla E. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 50 years old. Prescilla is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Prescilla E..

Prescilla is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Prescilla owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prescilla has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Prescilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prescilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Prescilla is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Prescilla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items to expand product offering

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Zenobia; ella tiene 61 años. La socia es soltera, y tiene 01 hijo; la socia se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella trabaja en el mercado de arco pata, ella educa a su hijo y desea lo mejor para él es por eso que año tras año se dedica a trabajar arduamente y ella elabora comidas caseras y vende en un stand pre fabricado por ella misma. La socia desea comprar al por mayor los insumos tales como azúcar, arroz, harinas, aceite y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y elaborar sus comiditas. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Senora Zenobia is a member of a communal bank called "Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco" ("New Dawn of Cuzco"). The communal bank is located in thee district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cuzco.

Senora Zenobia is 61 years old. She is single, and has a son. She dedicates her time to the sale of food, working in the Arco Pata market. She educates her son and wants the best for him: for this reason she works hard, year after year, making homemade dishes and selling them at a stall specially built for the purpose. She wants to buy staple ingredients such as sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil, and other things. She is seeking the loan to buy ingredients and make her dishes.

She is happy to be eligible for the loan and promises to complete her repayments on time and in the proper place.

loans.use: The member of this communal bank is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol. she requested a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. Julia is 30 years old and married to a businessman . She has 4 children and 3 of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to pay school fees for her children and buy land to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 60 años, vive en su casa que es propia solo, pues hace varios años se separó de su esposa y sus cinco hijos ya son mayores y trabajan independientes. Este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la construcción de grandes obras; desde muy joven aprendió observando a sus familiares que se desempeñaban en el oficio. En la actualidad tiene su empresa de construcción, y aunque le faltan algunos permisos opera junto a otros tres obreros, y él les guía pues es el maestro en este oficio. Le gusta mucho su labor ya que manifiesta que es reconfortante observar las grandes obras terminadas con buen acabado, y es por esta razón que tiene varios clientes que lo recomiendan y no le falta trabajo ya que siempre esta empezando o terminando una construcción. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar una camioneta para que sus obreros  se movilicen sin problemas. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Abraham tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una máquina mezcladora de cemento, pues es un instrumento que le hace falta para terminar las obras con mayor rapidez y calcula que obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Abraham is 60 years old and lives alone in his own home. He separated with his wife a number of years ago and his five children are already grown up and working. This enterprising man makes a living in construction. Since he was a young man he learned from watching his relatives who worked in the trade. Currently he has a construction company, and although he lacks a few permits he manages with three other workers. He oversees them since he is the master builder. He really enjoys his work and says it is heartwarming to see the big jobs completed with good results. It's for this reason he has various clients who recommend him, and he doesn't lack for work since he is always starting or completing construction. For the future, he plans on purchasing a pickup truck so that his workers can move around without problems. This is his fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time since he doesn't want to be in bad standing with the people who made this support possible and so that he can continue working in search of progress. Abraham plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a cement mixing machine since it is an instrument he is missing in order to finish his jobs more quickly, and he calculates that he will earn better profits.

loans.use: Purchase a cement mixing machine

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Oem S., age 21, is a mother blessed with a small child. She currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day by selling Khmer cake. Oem S.'s husband works in a private company as a sales representative. Oem S. is requesting this loan because she wishes to purchase a plot of farmland, which she will use for a farming business. This loan will thus provide her with a new additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to use for a farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child.  She is from Lebanon. She sells a wide range of goods from her home to customers from her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works in his own garage. Her goods are enjoyed by members of her community. She sells different Lebanese food and products.

Today she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven and additional tools needed for her cooking work. In the future, she would like to rent out a space to sell her merchandise, as well as sell popular home-made food products.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven and additional tools

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Age:                            33
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      3
Business:                    providing shirt making services to local community members
Loan purpose:              to purchase additional fabrics and materials
Weekly profit:              350 WST   ($146)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               2 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.9 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.9 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

Fiapito owns and operates a business venture, providing shirt-making services to local community members.  She has two years of experience in this business.    

Fiapito needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase additional fabrics and supplies.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST or about $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Fiapito joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Fiapito's 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 63 old married father of one, living in Baalback. Ali has been selling used shoes at  wholesale since 1998. He is a hard worker who forces himself to work harder day after day in order to provide his family with a secure standard of living. Ali is a man with good reputation; he's very experienced in this field and all of his clients are business who sell used shoes at retail. His shop is in a very good place in his area, and many passing by visit him to have a look and most of the time they buy special pairs. Ali hopes to reach a time where he can rest and watch his business grow.

loans.use: to buy a big quantity of used shoes

loans.name: Wilson Paulino

texts.es: El sr. Wilson vive la zona de Cota Cota, el es soltero vive junto a  sus  tres hermanos todos independientes, el se dedica a costura desde hace  tiempo el estuvo en la Republica de Argentina por motivo de trabajo hace un años atrás ahí es donde aprendió a confeccionar Edredones,  actualmente tiene un taller en su mismo domicilio y elabora solo los edredones lo cual distribuye por el centro por mayor y menor, y tiene clientes que la buscan para un determinada cantidad a las cuales les da por mayor, cuenta con dos maquinas tiene planeado ampliar mas adelante su taller comprando mas maquinas, solicita el crédito para la compra de  fibra  por mayor y tela para la confección de edredones, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilson lives in the Cota Cota zone. He’s single and lives with his three independent siblings.  He’s been a Tailor for quite some time.  He was in Argentina for work-related reasons and that’s where he learned how to manufacture comforters.  He currently has a workshop at his house and he manufactures only comforters that he sells downtown both at wholesale and at retail.  He has two sewing machines and plans later on to expand the shop buying more machines.  He’s asking for the loan to buy fabric and stuffing to make comforters.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric and fiber.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is a 43-year-old businesswoman.  She is married and has 4 children and an additional dependent, who lives with her as a result of her mother's death. In 2001, Mariatu established her business selling traveling boxes, DVD laptops and ladies' bags. She began her business to realize her dream of independence. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy more goods for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: María Evangelina

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso, vive por la comunidad de Sayausi en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad  mas importante del país, su clima es frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de  9, 7, 5 y 1 año de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar,  allí cría ganado, ovejas, chanchos, gallinas y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta. También se dedica a bordar pero solo bajo pedido.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales.
 
Su meta es de tener un local propio para vender sus bordados.
texts.en:
Sra. María P. is a member of the Communal Bank “Libertad en Progreso” (Freedom in Progress). She lives in the community of Sayausi in the city of Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador. Even though the climate is cold, the people have very warm hearts and are able to maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 32 years old, married, and has four children (ages 9, 7, 5, and 1). The first three children attend school. Her husband is a mason by profession and they worked together to build their own home.

Sra. María takes care of the household chores. She also raises sheep, pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs for personal consumption and to sell. In addition, María makes embroideries but only when she has orders.

She is receiving her second loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of more animals. Her goal is to have a shop where she can sell her embroideries.

loans.use: to purchase animals.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is from the village of Bura, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Sabina is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing a billiard hall for games to local community members. She also makes and sells wood charcoal in sacks. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $285 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sabina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools and utilities for the maintenance of the service. 

Sabina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials and pay utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials and pay utilities.

loans.name: Kyzylgul's Group

texts.en:
Kyzylgul is 49 and is married to a famer. Together with her husband, she has raised three sons, all of whom are also farmers. In 1991, when the Soviet Union broke up, the family got a piece of land and since then they have earned money by cultivating agricultural products and breeding livestock. 

Kyzylgul is the leader of this loan group. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more livestock. With money gained from reselling her livestock, Kyzylgul wants to improve her family’s living conditions. In the future, she wants to save money to purchase a vehicle for her older son so that he will be able to work as a taxi driver.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Erika Carolina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conocimos  a Erika,  tiene 25 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le están dando ya que con los créditos ella tiene una forma para ganarse la vida.

Ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, este producto entregan en Manta a comerciantes para que estos la exporten al extranjero. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h30 hasta las 15h00, trabaja unas seis horas por día, nos cuenta que es sacrificado el trabajo pero esta es su forma de comenzar a tener algo para su futuro. La materia prima la compra en un depósito en la localidad que les surte de este producto.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua y dos tornos más para así poder aumentar su producción. 

Su sueño es tener una gran empresa de botones terminados.
texts.en: Every two weeks, the Virgen del Rosario community bank meets in Colorado, in Montecristi canton. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are both nationally and internationally renowned. Most of the people work making buttons from 'tagua' (vegetable ivory), making handicrafts and engaging in general commercial activities. Here we meet 25 year-old Erika who is single and lives in her parents' home. She has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the help that she is receiving. Thanks to the loans, she has a way of earning a living. Erika has a lathe (a machine for cutting 'tagua') which she uses to make buttons (but crudely). She delivers her products to salespeople in Manta who then export them abroad. She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.30am to 3.00pm. She works six hours a day. She tells us that the work is hard but this is her way of starting to build something for her future. She buys her raw materials from a warehouse in her town which supplies this product. Erika will use this loan to buy 'tagua' and two more lathes so that she can increase her production. Her dream is to own a large company that makes finished buttons.

loans.use: to buy 'tagua' and two lathes

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora María de los Ángeles, vive en la localidad  de San Miguel, ella es casada con el señor Ramiro y con quien procreo dos hijos, Demisio Ramiro de nueve años  y  Liliana  de cuatro años.

    Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra  de platicos de la marca tupperware como son: cubetas, tupper, vasos, como también  colchas,  entre otros y con esta actividad  lleva un año y cuatro meses y esta contenta porque le está dando un buen resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su familia  para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y  así juntos trabajar para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su  pequeña familia.

    Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo ella pueda tener su propia distribuidora de productos de esta marca para apoyar a otras personas que como ella tienen una pequeña actividad.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles lives in the San Miguel community. She is married to Ramiro with whom she has two children, Demisio Ramiro who is nine years old and Liliana who is four. 

She requested the loan to invest in the purchase of Tupperware brand plastics such as buckets, tupperware, and cups, as well as bedspreads among other items. She has been doing this for a year and four months and is happy because it is yielding good profits. 

Her motivation for starting this activity was her family so that she could support her husband with income for the household, and thus work together to give a better quality of life to their small family. 

What she wishes for most is that, with time, she would have her own business by which she might have the means to continue working in the future, and be a distributor so she can support other people with this activity.

loans.use: to purchase plastic dishware.

loans.name: Gema Elizabeth

texts.es: Gema Elizabeth tiene 39 años, a pesar con las situaciones que ha pasado ha logrado sobrellevar las dificultades que se le han presentado. Su actividad es una pulpería en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, jugos, pan, galletas, café, sal, fósforos entre otros. Con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado fortaleza su actividad con nuevos productos y además incrementar poco a poco su inventario. Sueña con lograr convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en: Gema Elizabeth is 39 years old.  In spite of the situations she has been through, she has been able to handle the difficulties that have come up.  Gema Elizabeth's business is a small grocery in which she offers a large variety of products for sale: staple grains, juices, bread, cookies, coffee, salt and matches, among other items.  Over time she has been able to strengthen her business with new products and also increase her inventory little by little.  Gema Elizabeth's dream is to convert her grocery into a distribution center.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, juices, bread, cookies, coffee, salt, matches and other items.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is age 29 and has been farming for nine years. He is married with two children, ages 6 and 2 years old, with the first born already in school. He lives with his family in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He makes additional income from a motorcycle business.

Collins has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says the better breeds he wants to purchase will double his income from the dairy business and improve his family's standard of living immensely. Collins says a number of farmers can't access funds to do meaningful business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 36 years old and married. He has an only child to care for. The family settled to make a living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jaime has been a fisherman for eight years, until the present. He has been paddling around fishing routes to make a living. Obviously, it is a difficult and risky thing to do, but he has to ignore what might happen in order to feed his family. He earns a total of PHP 5,000 a month from his fishing activity.

In 2010, Jaime joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from the cooperative to purchase materials needed to fix his fishing net. Tiny-holed fishing nets have a bigger chance to catch more. Jaime plans to engage in seaweed production to gain more income and improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to fix his fishing net.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 72 años y 05 hijos; que ya cuentan con familia propia. Ante la necesidad D. generar sus propios ingresos se  inicia  como costurera confeccionando prendas D. vestir, actividad  que  deja por motivos D. salud ya que su edad no le permitía estar esforzándose mucho, deciD. entonces implementar su negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, iniciando así con un capital inicial D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles.
Actualmente incrementó su negocio y se siente muy satisfecha y más tranquila, cuenta con muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 comprará sacos D. arroz, azúcar, aceite en docenas, leche en tarro, leche en caja , fideos en kilos, conservas D. pescado y en variedad D. marcas, verduras, frutas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes.Rosa, es una mujer emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con una tienda mayorista y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank “María Auxiliadora”, which is in the District of Tarapoto, in the Province and Department of San Martín.  She is a widow, is 72 years old, and has five children who have their own families.

Because she needed to earn her own income, she began working as a tailor, making clothes.  She had to leave this activity for health reasons and as her age did not allow her to take on anything too arduous, she decided to start a business selling everyday items.  She started this with initial capital of 300 New Soles.

Currently, she has grown her business and feels very satisfied and more calm.  She has many good customers because of her charisma and good service.

With this loan of 1,000 Soles, she will buy bags of rice, sugar, oil by the dozen, bottle so milk, cartons of milk, noodles by the kilo, canned fish and a variety of brands, vegetables, fruit, and personal hygiene products, so as to continue to proviD. good service for her customers.

Rosa is an enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have a wholesale store, and she is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries: rice, oil, milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic for making baskets.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 43 years old and is a housewife. Her husband is a musician who earns 3 USD per day. The couple has four children: one is studying, and the other three are working in a factory each earning 3 USD daily. Each month, Sina has to spend 47 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses.

Sina is requesting a 500 USD loan to buy materials to repair her house. She hopes to send her last child to study at the university so that he will have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 57-year-old lady who is from Semarang. Yuliana is married to Joseph, a 43-year-old man. They are blessed with four children namely: Stevany, 23, married; Ivan, 21, and Yustin, 19, both of whom graduated from senior high school; and Armando, 17, who is studying at the second grade of senior high school. 

Yuliana owns a piglet breeding business. She has been involved in this business for eight months. She started the business by purchasing two piglets. Yuliana is interested in running the business since the income is generated quickly; she only needs six months to raise and sell them. According to Yulia this business enables her to meet their daily needs. 

Currently, Yuliana plans to raise more piglets but she needs more money to do so. She is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM to purchase four piglets and fodder. Yuliana really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business. She believes that the loan will motivate her to go forward.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and fodder

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из города Хуст, на западе Украины. Она торгует тканями и фурнитурой в местном универмаге. Конкуренции, как таковой, особо нет. Товар пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентская база. В этом бизнесе Ирина находится уже 10 лет. На данный момент ее чистая прибыль составляет 7 000 гривен. 

Ирине необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы поехать за приобретением товара и пополнения оборотных средств. Ирину хорошо знают покупатели, потому что она всегда привозит качественный товар и никогда не предложит второсортный материал. Она дорожит своей репутацией честного предпринимателя. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Ирина надеется и в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес, улучшая жилищные условия и еще активнее расширяя ассортимент товара. 
Пометка: история на РУССКОМ язык
texts.en: Irina is from the town of Khoost in the western Ukraine.  She sells fabrics and furniture at the local department store and has no significant competition.  Her merchandise is in demand, and she has her own client base.  Irina has been in this business for 10 years.  Her current net profit amounts to 7,000 hryvnia.  Irina needs additional funds in the sum of 5,000 hryvnia in order to travel and buy merchandise and refill her revolving capital.  She is well known among customers because she always brings in quality merchandise and would never offer a second-rate fabric.  She values her reputation as an honest entrepreneur.  After obtaining the additional profit, Irina hopes to develop her business further, improve living conditions and actively expand merchandise selection.

loans.use: to travel and buy merchandise and refill her revolving capital

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en: Mounira is a 27-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. In 2008, she opened a clothing store in her town where she started to sell different types of clothes. Today, she is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to get the new winter clothes collection. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she plans to open a branch of her shop.

loans.use: to get the new winter clothes collection

loans.name: Zenaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zenaida, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, sus hijos aun son dependientes, Ella aprendió el oficio desde muy joven, como un oficio doméstico, pero al formar su familia, el dedicarse a hacer tortillas fue una fuente de ingreso para su familia.
Actualmente necesita comprar insumos como Maíz, leña y gas, esta compra le ayudara para mantener lo necesario en el negocio y poder continuar con la producción de tortillas.
El sueño de Zenaida es tener un negocio con más capacidad, aumentar su clientela y proveer para sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Zenaida earns a living selling tortillas. She lives with her husband and three dependent children. She was taught to make tortillas at home at a young age, but once she had a family, she worked at making tortillas to provide a source of income for her family.

She currently needs to buy supplies such as corn, firewood and gas. These purchases will provide her with what her business needs and allow her to keep making tortillas.

It is Zenaida's dream to expand her business, increase her clientele and provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas to make tortillas.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen is 45 years old. She lives in Pho Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has a store where she sells products made from iron, such as iron nails and screwdrivers. She has had this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 8,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and always repaid loans punctually. This is the 6th time she has borrowed money from SEDA. This time she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to repair her store to have more space to store iron products.

loans.use: to repair her store to have more space to store iron products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 200 balls of wool to knit jersey and three buckets of matemba to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.  Marilyn is makes & sells snacks like rice cakes or bibingka. She has been running this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making the rice cakes.  Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making rice cakes

loans.name: Natalia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Natalia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia del país, por su actividad económica, tiene una gran riqueza cultural, gastronómica, su gente es amable y mantiene las tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Natalia tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una panadería, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella se dedica al comercio informal, vende cobijas, edredones, sabanas y mas mercadería, esta actividad la realiza hace un año y medio, hace 6 meses labora también ejerciendo su profesión que es la de oficial de enfermería.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de cobijas, sabanas y edredones para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Victorious Women) communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful place in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important because of its economic activity.  It has great cultural and gastronomic riches.  Its people are kind and maintain their parents’ traditions.

Natalia is 21 years old, married and has a 2-year-old daughter.  Her husband works in a bakery.  She does not own a house, she is a renter.

She is an informal merchant; she sells blankets, comforters, sheets and other merchandise.  She’s been in this business a year and a half and six months ago also started working in her profession which is nursing.

This is her fourth loan and she will use it to buy blankets, sheets and comforter to expand her business.  Her goal is to have a locale to sell her merchandise in.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Alice Chirondo

texts.en:
Alice Chirondo is a 33-year-old posho mill owner in Mariakani. She is married and a mother of five children. Alice has been running this business for the past two years and she is doing great. 
Alice was introduced to Kiva partner KADET and this is her third loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase another posho mill and a motorcycle for business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and repay her loan. 
Alice hopes to do well and have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase another posho mill and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу  проживает в селе Ленин жолу на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Канымбу    с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,   Канымбу содержит бычков в своем хозяйстве, продажа мясных продуктов позволяет зарабатывать для семьи около 9,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Канымбу  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы   Канымбу планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kanymbu lives in the Lenin-Zhol village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Much like many families in the rural area, Kanymbu and her husband fatten up livestock, having started this business with an initial sum of 8,000 som (KGS).  Today, she keeps bulls in her household, and sales of meat products allows the family to earn about 9,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further expand her business, Kanymbu requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the profits into building a large shed for livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nzioki

texts.en:
Nzioki is a married man. He has two children 5 months and 6 years old. He describes himself as a focused man. He operates a garage where he sells and repairs motor vehicle wheels. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and fast-growing town and his primary customers are businesspeople within the town. 

He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy food ingredients for preparing meals. His business goal is to run many garages in his town.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for opening a new restaurant for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Bun Kong

texts.en:
Bun Kong is 37 years old. He is a father of four children who resides with his wife and his mother in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a sculptor who earns about $7 per day. His wife is involved in weaving. Approximately, she earns $2 per day. 

Bun Kong wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Bun Kong is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to build his house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to run a grocery store for his wife and help his children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Jlg-008(A)-Kulithalai Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. The leader of a group of 3, Mariyayi, a 35 year old woman and mother of two, living in the state of Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But she does not have the means to build one. Without access to a toilet, her family is forced to walk a kilometer just to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. The family members, especially their women & daughters are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Taking matters into their own hands, Mariyayi and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses, and they will repay the loan amount on time. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.en:
Maria Graciela is married and has two sons. She has a shoe sales business and has more than six years with the business. She started her business due her economic situation. She needed to start her own business in order to suppourt her family and educate her two sons. She has the opportunity to travel frequently to Moroleon and this city is one of the most competitive cities in Mexico in leather also in shoes. Buying there, she could obtain a great margin of utilities selling her merchandise in Nuevo Leon. Maria Graciela is requesting for a loan of US$ 650 to purchase merchandise and take advantage of this change of season and Christmas. She comments that she will pay this loan in six months at least, and if she gets this opportunity she could increase her sales and also her incomes.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria Graciela esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ya tiene en este negocio más de seis años, inicio en este negocio por la necesidad económica y tenia que aportar ingresos para los gastos familiares y para poder vivir y educar a sus hijos. Comenzó en este negocio por que ella tiene la facilidad de ir a Moroleón muy a menudo y en esa ciudad es una de las más competitivas en artículos de piel y zapatos en general, por ello comprando allá puede obtener utilidades vendiendo los zapatos en Nuevo León, ya que son de buena calidad y a buen precio, por ello Maria Graciela esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 650 para comprar mercancía y poder vender en este cambio de temporada y época de navideña. Comenta que pagará este crédito en 6 meses y que si le brindan esa oportunidad podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hasanaga

texts.en:
Hasanaga owns a furniture store in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Easter part of Azerbaijan. Hasanaga wants to invest in a greater variety of furniture for an increasing customer base.
His store is a family business and his whife (Malahat Kazimova), who also received loan from Normicro Baku branch, uses this fund in the same furniture store. Together they need 2350$ to buy new inventories for the store. Hasanaga applies for the half of that amount.

loans.use: To increase variety of furniture in his store

loans.name: Jusdy Nelly

texts.en:
Jusdy is married with two small children. Her husband is a carpenter. His income depends on the amount of work he is able to obtain as he has no fixed salary. Faced with this situation, Judy saw the need to earn an extra income to allow her to cover the household debts. For the past four years, she has been in the business of selling clothing. She started selling only children’s and women’s clothes, but as the business began to do well she expanded into the sale of shoes and clothes for the whole family.

Jusdy is now seeking a loan of $250 to obtain the merchandise needed to offer a greater selection of products and meet the demands of her customers. She is offering to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business. Don’t hesitate any longer and support Jusdy.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Jusdy es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo es carpintero, y el ingreso que obtiene depende del trabajo que pueda conseguir, porque no tiene un trabajo fijo. Ante esta situación, Jusdy se vio en la necesidad de obtener u ingreso extra que le permitiera cubrir las deudas de su hogar, desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició sólo con ropa de niños y dama, pero como obtuvo buenos resultados fue incorporando la venta de zapatos y ropa para toda la familia.

Ahora Jusdy necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares con lo que obtendrá mercancía para tener una mayor variedad de productos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver este crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Jusdy.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
M. Gulbahor is married and has 3 children. She is a very talented and creative person. She  has over 17 years experience in embroidery/fancywork.
She became known in Khujand when she exhibited her first collection of embroidered national dresses at a national   exhibition in 2000 and took first place; after that she received many proposals from theatres, dressmaking and tailoring establishments who were interested in long term partnerships.
Today she has her own sewing workshop with 3 modern embroidery machines, 4 sewing and 2 looping machines.
Gulbahor plans to spend her next loan to purchase modern summer fabrics for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of modern fabrics

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is an internally displaced person from the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. She lives in a hostel together with her family of 5 chldren. Her husband died in the Garbakh war. Since 2003 she has rented a cafe near the place where they live. This is the only source of income for a considerably large family. She employs five additional people. Her daughter, Raifa, also works in the cafe. (She is pictured). Zohra wants to develop the business. She applied to the Normicro Baku branch for a loan of $700 to buy minor furniture such as tables and chairs to be able to serve more clients.

loans.use: To buy small furniture

loans.name: Felisberto António

texts.pt:
Felisberto António V. is married and a father of 5 children. He has a bar, with a small store and a celular telephone available for public use. He entered the program in June 2006 with an initial loan for 3,000MT. He never missed a repayment. His client base grew considerably compared to when his business was first evaluated at the beginning of the program: he increased his stock volume and expanded his business by purchasing cellular phones for public use. He is now in his 4th loan cycle and wants to take out 16,000MT to be repaid within 8 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Felisberto António V. vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos. Tem uma barraca, uma mini-mercearia e telefone celular público. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 3.000MT. Nunca teve falhas nos reembolsos. O cliente evoluíu consideravelmente no negócio se tomarmos como ponto de referência o estado do mesmo aquando da 1ª avaliação: aumentou o volume do stock e expandiu comprando telefones celulares públicos. Vai para o 4º ciclo e vai Tomar 16.000MT pagável em 8 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Elyor

texts.en: Elyor is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. His business is to sell carpets of different sizes. He bought his goods from the carpet factory in Kayrakum, Khujand, Tajikistan. His business is located in the Spitamen market. He has a stable business and his assets are increasing every month. He has repaid his loan on time without any problems. His turnover is fast and now he has received a big order for three sizes of carpets (2x3,1.5x1 and 3.5x4). He needs extra capital to purchase carpets from the factory.

loans.use: Purchase 20 carpets (2x3), 40 small carpets (1.5x1) and 10 of the biggest carpets (3.5x4).

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.es:
She has had this business for a year and a half. Before this, she worked for a driving school, but that job did not allow her to take care of her children. With this business she can tend to them and give them what they need to make it. She has four children who depend on her income, because she is a single mother. She started her business with 100 dollars, and to this day she has invested US$ 500 in vegetables and supplies. One of the greatest challenges when she started the business was knowing where to buy and at what price, but now she has the experience necessary to make good investments. She needs the loan to stock up on fruits and vegetables, which she is lacking because of lack of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio lo tiene desde hace año y medio , antes era empleada de una escuela de manejo, pero ese empleo no le permitía el estar pendiente del cuido de sus hijos, este negocio le da la oportunidad de atenderlos y darles lo necesario para salir adelante tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de sus ingresos ella es madre soltera , inicio su negocio con cien dolares hasta la fecha tiene invertido quinientos dolares entre verduras y artículos de consumo, uno de los mayores retos al iniciar el negocio fue el poder saber adonde comprar y a que precio hacerlo,pero hasta la fecha ya tiene la experiencia necesaria para poder hacer buenas inversiones , su financiamiento lo necesita para poder surtir con verduras y frutas que por el momento no tiene debido a los recursos económicos.

loans.use: Buying vegetables such as tomato, potato, lettuce, peppers and fruits which she is not yet selling in her business (Su inversión sera para compra  de verduras tomates papas lechuga  chile dulce y  Frutas que todavía  no vende en su negocio.)

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Agustin V. worked as a driver for an electronic shop for two years before deciding that he wanted to form his own small business. He began by buying small electric home products, rope and other merchandise to sell door to door.

With a loan issued to him by Fundación Paraguaya, he was able to buy a motorcycle and transport goods with much more ease. Having a mode of transportation opened up many more possibilities for the expansion of his business. While he was away on deliveries his wife stayed home to take care of their two children.

Today his dream is to save enough money to open his own store in his house. As a traveling salesman, he is away from home a lot and would like to be around his children more of the time. However, he knows that his income is the only way to give his children the opportunity to attend school, an experience he wishes he had as a child.

loans.use: To buy fans, grills, sheets, mosquito nets, and jeans.

loans.name: Totoh Isah

texts.en: Totoh, 36, is married to H., and they have 3 children. Her husband cannot provide regular income for the family, and Totoh earns the family income by selling kitchen wears such as pans, frying pans, iron cases, etc., door-to-door around villages, earning $15 a day. She is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business so she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily E. is 50 years old. A widow with one child, she lives in Benin City. She runs a restaurant in a very good location in Benin City, where she sells all kinds of drinks and pepper soup. She acquired the knowledge of her business from her sister over a period of two years and started her own restaurant in 1996. She has been with LAPO for eight years as a dedicated client, and now she needs a loan of $875 to buy more drinks for her restaurant. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Daler D. lives in Yavan. He is 22 years old and is married but doesn’t have children yet. He studies at the Tajik Pedagogical University. In order to pay for his education and help provide for his family, Daler started buying and selling cattle. He buys young bull-calves, fattens them for 40-45 days and then resells them at the local market. He wants a loan to increase his turnover, which in turn will increase his profits. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Давлатов Далер проживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей женой . Ему 22 года и детей пока не имеет. Учится в Таджикском Педагогическом университете . Для того чтобы оплачивать обучение и прокормить семью, он занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , а потом продает на рынке . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 5 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и получаемый доход .Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Choeum

texts.en:
Choeum S. is 49 years old and is living in Siem Reap province. She is a widow, still working the farm that she and her husband first bought together. Her earnings are meager, coming to $1 USD per day on average.

She has three children, one of who was recently married. The two unmarried children attend school and still live with her. They try to help her with the farm in their spare time. Her oldest daughter works her own farm, while her husband is a construction worker. They also help to support her as best they can.

Choeum S. is very grateful for her son-in-law’s support and wants to help him specialize as a carpenter in his construction business. Her loan will go to buying him much-needed tools, which will make him a much more valuable asset to his employers.

The picture shows her daughter, becausae Choeum S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Jaime Will

texts.es:
Since he was a little boy, Jaime Will O. has learned to work on the farm and since has devoted himself to his agricultural business raising crops and animals.

After many years, Jaime has managed to improve his financial situation and he is now able to care more for his crops and animals. He has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase inputs for his harvest, as well as for taking care of his animals. He hopes his loan application will be approved so he can continue with his agricultural business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Jaime Will O. desde que era un pequeño niño aprendió a trabajar en el campo dedicándose al negocio agropecuario o sea con la agricultura y los animales en su crianza para su respectivo desarrollo.

Hoy en día a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar en parte su situación económica y les ha dado un mejor cuido y atención a sus animales y a sus cultivos. La razón por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para la cosecha y además para la crianza de los animales. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar con su negocio en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for planting crops

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Mrs. Savorn C. lives in the Spork Reach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She earns income working as a thatch seller. Mrs. C. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business and has fully paid it back. Since her business now is doing well, Mrs. Savorn C. wants to expand it and is therefore asking for a loan to buy more thatches to re-sell. She is 48 years old and has a son who works as a construction worker. Mrs. C.'s husband, Mr. Sameourn Pun, is a farmer. Last year, Mr. Sameourn Pun fell sick with a liver disease, and Mrs. Savorn C. spent US$300 for his treatment. This is part of the reason why Mrs. Savorn C. currently needs to borrow money for the purchase of additional thatches.

loans.use: Purchase of thatches for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Sarah sells onions at Abura, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is an ex-policeman. Sarah uses her income to pay for family expenses.

Sarah will use the loan to purchase 6 more bags of onions for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to add to her capital to increase sales.

loans.use: purchase 6 more bags of onions for sale

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Hương, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 23010111), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi bò. Chị đang sống cùng chồng vá hai con gái tại thôn Lực Canh Xuân Canh Đông Anh Hà Nội. Hàng ngày, ngoài công việc đồng áng, chăn nuôi, chị vẫn đi làm thuê như phu hồ, nhặt quă mơ để làm ô mai,...Chồng chị là thợ xây, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ /tháng. Ở thôn chị là một cán bộ phụ nữ năng động, nhiệt tình với các hoạt động phong trào nên trong làng ai cũng biết và yêu quý chị. Cùng tham gia vay vốn với chị còn có:
Nguyễn Thị Chi, sinh năm 1977 (Ms 23010107), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ bán rau, gà.
Vũ Thị Luật, sinh năm 1977 (Ms 23010108), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư nuôi gà(mua thêm 200 con gà giống)
Lê Thị Chín, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 23010109), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng nay mặc.
Nguyễn Thị Hương, sinh năm 1957 (Ms 23010110), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.(lợn, bò, gà)
Nguyễn Thị Thu, sinh năm 1970 (Ms 23010112), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
Nguyễn Thành, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 23010011), tham gia vay vốn mức: 1.060.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ hoa quả.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID Number 23010111), born in 1965, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to invest in rearing cows. She lives with her husband and her two daughters at Luc Canh village, Xuan Canh town, Đong Anh, Ha Noi. Everyday, besides farming and raising livestock, mrs. Huong also works as a hired worker in construction sites, and picks up apricots to make sugared dry apricots for saL.. Her husband is a construction worker. Her family's average monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 152USD). Mrs. Huong is an active and enthusiastic officer of her village's woman association, so the villagers all know and like her. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Chi (ID Number 23010107), born in 1977, borrows 4,452,000VND to sell vegetabL. and chicken.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Luat (ID Number 23010108), born in 1977, borrows 4,452,000VND to invest in raising chicken (purhchasing 200 breeding chickens).
  • Mrs. L. Thi Chin (ID Number 23010109), born in 1978, borrows 4,452,000VND to invest in her tailoring shop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID Number 23010110), born in 1957, borrows 4,452,000VND to raise livestock (pigs, chickens, cows).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID Nubmer 23010112), born in 1970, borrows 4,452,000VND to raise livestock.
  • Mrs. N. Thanh (ID Number 23010011), born in 1973, borrows 1,060,000VND to buy and sell fruits.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Maritza  Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña maritza es una mujer bien trabajadora que se ha dedicado a la venta de granos básicos y carne de res, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama barrio 380, tiene 38 años de edad, y con una niña de 9 años que esta cursando la primaria, su esposos trabaja en una universidad desempeñándose como jefe de bodega. Su negocio es la venta de carnes de res y pollo que inicio hace doce años lo cual le ha permitido captar muchos clientes y ha sido su fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia,  vende al cantado y al crédito a los comedores. Con la solicitud del préstamo lo quiere para invertir en su vivienda en la reparación del techo del porche que esta en mal estado y también mejorar el sumidero para tener mejor seguridad y mejores condiciones. A largo plazo es poder vender otros productos que le generen ganancias y obtener más clientes, poder tener salud para ofrecer estudios a su hija.
texts.en:
Maritza is a hard working woman that works selling basic grains and beef. She lives in a neighborhood of the capital city Managua called Neighborhood 380. She is 38 years old and has a 9 year old daughter that is in elementary school. Her husband works in a university as the manager of a store. Maritza's business is selling beef and chicken, which she started two years ago and has gained many customers. The business has been her income source to help her family. With this loan she would like to invest it in her house to repair the roof of her porch, which is in bad condition, as well as improve her sewer drain so that she has more security and better living conditions. In the long term she would like to be able to sell other products to gain more income and customers and to remain in good health to be able to provide an education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of roof and sewer drain

loans.name: Mpoki N.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 18-year-old Mpoki N. from Tukuyu, a married woman who has been operating a crop-selling business since 2002. Assisted by her husband, she works at the business four hours per day, seven days per week, earning a monthly profit of about $50.

She is now requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy more crops in bulk, and in the future plans to expand and establish another business. Mpoki thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret H. sells bread at the bakery and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 31 years old and married. Her husband is a builder. She has seven children, who all go to school. With the extra profit generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for accommodation.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her bakery.

loans.name: Winona

texts.en: Winona L., 30, is married with 3 children. She has 1 year of experience in an elei printing business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Winona’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase printing boards, fabric paints, painting brush and cotton roller.

loans.use: To purchase printing boards, fabric paints, fabrics, painting brush and cotton roller.

texts.es:
El señor julio trabaja para una maquiladora en el área de soldadura con una antigüedad de 2 años, su esposa trabaja para una fabrica y su hijo el mayor también labora para una empresa conocida dentro de la ciudad. 
Ellos demostrando que el esfuerzo, la constancia y la unión familiar es la base de todo, han salido adelante, y ahora están solicitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa ya que con tanta lluvia se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio R. has been working in the welding department of an assembly plant for 2 years. His wife works for a factory, while their eldest son works for a well-known company in the city.

They have gotten ahead in life, demonstrating that effort, perseverance and family unity are the foundation for everything. They are now requesting this loan in order to waterproof the roof of their house because it has deteriorated with the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Namuyanja Pauline Group

texts.en:
Pauline is 74 years of age, and is a widow with 7 children aged between 31 and 52. Pauline sells charcoal to earn a living. She rents a four room house, where three people currently stay. She also has access to electricity and piped water. She cares for her grandchildren who lost their parents and came to stay with her. They have three meals a day. Her greatest expense at the end of the month is mainly school fees for her children.

She also sells grasshoppers, during their season, at the market. She works seven days a week and she pays rent for the place she works. Pauline normally receives about 10 people a day, both men and women. She sells her products on a retail basis, and has been in this business for over 10 years.

Pauline complains of the very expensive transportation from the villages where she purchases her goods. And the grasshoppers only come seasonally, which is twice a year. She has worked with MCDT for six years now and she chose to work with MCDT because of the school fees loan they give to their clients. She will use this loan to increase her stock and she also hopes to educate her grandchildren until they graduate from university.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Y. Isaac is 31 years old. He is married and has two children: a boy and a girl. The daughter is currently in the basic school while the son has yet to start. His wife is a seamstress by profession. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming.

Isaac is a tailor by profession and yet trades in palm oil as well. He produces palm oil and distributes it. He procures palm fruits from the farmers in his community and those in the surrounding towns. He distributes the palm oil to food vendors and to customers who also resell it.

Isaac wants a loan to procure palm nuts in large quantities so that he can produce oil in bulk and distribute it to the his increasing number of customers. He has been in business for four years. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy vive en la calle “ Nicolas Bravo”  de la zona  Villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 8 años respectivamente, en su domicilio que heredó de sus padres.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de un minibús de transporte publico, entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de repuestos para la reparación del motor de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Willy lives on "Nicolas Bravo" Street in the Villa Cooperativa zone of the city of El Alto.

He lives with his wife and their three children, who are 11, 9, and 8 years old, in the home he inherited from his parents.

He works as a driver and owner of a public transportation minibus between the cities of La Paz and El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase spare parts to repair the engine of his vehicle.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair the engine of his minibus.

loans.name: Virgillio

texts.en:
Virgilio G. is working so hard to provide for the needs of his family. He manages a small sari-sari (variety) store and sells a variety of goods like rice, sardines, instant noodles and other goods. He is 33 years old and both of his two children are in school.

He is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. The loan will truly help him win more customers. He thinks that when there are more displays in his store, he will earn more profit to support his family.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to help start and have their own businesses. CEVI helps provide livelihood. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his store

loans.name: Ami Holassé

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme a très tôt arrêté les études, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle a commencé en 2003 le commerce de pagnes. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante ce qui lui permet de toucher un plus grand nombre de clients et favorise l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire. Elle veut agrandir son commerce et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle arrive à aider ses sœurs.
texts.en:
This is a woman who stopped her studies very early on. In order to provide for herself, she started selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) in 2003. She sells as a traveling saleswoman, which enables her to reach a larger number of customers, and helps her increase her revenue. She wants to bolster her business, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 10 pieces of pagnes. With the income from her business, she manages to help her sisters.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Naief

texts.en:
Naief is a 54 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Naief has been working as a taxi driver for 20 years. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change his car tires and oil and do some maintenance work on his car. This is Naief's second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work.

Naief decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. He is special in his work because of his punctuality and he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To change his car tires and oil and do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Altine

texts.fr: Altine S. est une femme berger son activité principale est l’élevage des bovins. Elle fait ce métier depuis longtemps. Elle a passé toute sa vie à errer  en brousse avec ses boeufs et moutons. A chaque approche de l hivernage, elle achète des moutons qu’elle embouche pour les revendre à la tabaski c’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des moutons. Les  revenus tirés de son activité d’embouche lui permettra d’acheter des vivres pour sa famille et de réparer sa case.
texts.en:
Altine S. is a livestock raiser; her principal business is raising cattle. She has been in this sector for a long time. She has spent all her life wandering around the countryside with her cows and sheep. Each time the rainy season approaches, she buys sheep that she fattens for resale at Tabaski (a Muslim religious holiday, the Festival of Sacrifice). That is why she is requesting a loan to buy sheep. The income from her business will allow her to buy food for her family and repair her house.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sheep to fatten and re-sell

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si P., 32, is a widow. She is a hairdresser and a farmer on her own plot of farmland, with an income of 2 USD per day in Takeo Province. She lives with her three school-aged children and an old mother. Due to the difficulty of being responsible for the expenses of the three children and an old mother, she wants to take out a loan of 500 USD to expand her current hairdressing business. By doing this, she hopes that she will be able to generate more income because she is skillful in the business and she has repeat customers who always come to her shop when they need to attend a ceremony or a wedding party. (P. is pictured with ropes used for tying her cows.)

loans.use: Buying equipment for her barbershop

loans.name: Tshatchibara

texts.fr: Tshatchibara K. est une jeune femme de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’un petit garçon. Elle détient de puis 3 ans, une boutique d’alimentation générale à Adeta. Ce commerce est très prospère et Kandé souhaite créer une deuxième boutique dans un village environnant. Elle compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tshatchibara Kandé is a married young woman aged 25, and is the mother of one young boy. For 3 years, she has run a general food store in Adeta. This business is very prosperous, and Kandé hopes to set up a second shop in a neighbouring village. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a second shop

loans.name: Wahid

texts.en: Wahid is a 60-year-old married man with 3 children. He has owned a food market for the past 12 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Wahid is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new refrigerator and renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator and renovate his shop

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida D. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Florida is married and has 2 school-aged children. Florida operates a tailoring business. She provides general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In Oct. 2006, Florida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Florida is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP. These funds will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Florida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ganado ovino. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de llicllas para aumentar su mercadería para venderlos en la feria de Ilave, ella tiene su puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado.

Su deseo es poder comprarse una casita en Ilave  así podría poner una tienda de venta de ropas para educar a sus hijos.
