A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros

loans.use: Para la compra de Llicllas.

loans.name: Sica

texts.fr: E. Sica est née le 06 Août 1956 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Sica est analphabète et réside à Abomey Calavi au Sud du Bénin depuis 18 ans. Mariée à TOMASSE Vincent, un commerçant, Sica est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Sica et son mari supportent les charges de la famille. Sica vend des divers (savons, lait, sardines, sucres, …), des sandales, des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, oignons, piments, légumes, épices, huile rouge de  palme, etc.) et du poisson à son domicile et au marché de Cococodji, au Sud du Bénin.  C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Sica achète ces différents produits. Sica ambitionne  agrandir le volume de son activité. C’est cette raison qui l’a poussée à se rapprocher de ALIDé pour obtenir de financement.
texts.en:
Sica E. was born August 6, 1956 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin. Sica is illiterate and has lived in Abomey Calavi in Southern Benin for the past 18 years. Married to Vincent Tomasse, a shopkeeper, Sica is the mother of three children who have all been educated. She and her husband are responsible for the family expenditures. Sica sells a variety of products; soaps, milk, sardines, sugar, sandals, condiments (tomatoes, onions, peppers, vegetables, spices, palm oil) as well as fish, from her home and at the market in Cococodji, in the South. Sica buys these products at Dantokpa, the main international market of Benin. She hopes to increase her sales volume, and it is for this reason that pushed her to apply for a loan through Kiva partner Alidé.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing three dozen soaps, a carton of milk, three cartons of sugar, and condiments for sauce.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida S. has been engaged in the direct sale of personal products for three years and five years in the sale of Avon cosmetics. She is married to Rolando S. who is 53 years old; his major source of income comes from his farming. They are gifted with three children who are now adults, some of whom are working in Manila. Her employed children give her a little support if there is an emergency or a need for financial assistance.

Nida is requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP for additional capital so she can purchase more inventory. Presently, she hasn’t enough capital to fill her customers’ orders. She earns 25 percent of the retail price on every product that she sells. Her commissions serve as her source of income for herfamily.

loans.use: For additional capital to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima De Huaripachi Group

texts.es:
Esta alcancía comunal se formó hace tres años en el distrito D. Matucana, participan en elL. diez personas microempresarias, con los préstamos que recibieron durante este tiempo cada uno lo ha invertido en su negocio con objetivos diferentes. Tal es el caso D. Rosa B. que a sus 29 años es madre D. dos niños (10 y 3 años D. edad), hace cuatro años emprenD. el negocio D. comida D. manera ambulatoria, tiene una carreta móvil que compró con el dinero que le daba su esposo. Empezó a trabajar D. esta manera porque atravesaba una difícil situación económica, el dinero que daba su esposo para los gastos del hogar no alcanzaba.

Es así que al principio le fiaban los víveres para L. preparación D. sus comidas, al finalizar el día Rosa tenía que pagar estos productos con las ventas D. cachanga, café y pollo frito. Su esfuerzo, buen trato y deseo D. superarse hizo atraer mayor consumidores, con los préstamos que recibió compró platos, tasas, cubiertos, bancas y un toldo. Este negocio ha ayudado mucho a Rosa porque le ha permitido comprarles a sus pequeños hijos zapatos, ropa, útiles escolares y gastos básicos del hogar.

Necesita el crédito porque quiere renovar el toldo que se ha deteriorado por el uso así mismo una cocina D. mesa.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed three years ago in the Matucana district and is maD. up of ten micro-entrepreneurs. Each person has invested the loans they have received throughout the years in their businesses, though with different objectives. Rosa B., for example, is the mother of two children who are 10 and 3 years old. Four years ago, she started a food cart business with money her husband gave her. She started this business because of economic hardship; the money her husband earned was not enough for household needs. At the beginning, Rosa would take out on credit the supplies she needed, and at the end of the day, she would pay the store back with what she earned selling "cachangas" (large flat bread), coffee, and fried chicken. Rosa's efforts, her nice manner, and her desire to succeed led to more customers. With the loans she received, she has bought plates, cups, silverware, benches, and a tent. This business has helped Rosa a lot, since it has allowed her to buy shoes, clothes and school supplies for her little ones, and to pay for basic household needs. She needs the new loan because she wants to buy a kitchen table and to repair the tent, which has deteriorated after much use.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing/supplying business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie O. is from the municipality of Manticao in Misamis Oriental province on the island of Mindanao. She is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. Tessie’s main source of income comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Tessie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Tessie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first from HSPFI, to be used to buy more seafood products to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional seafood products to sell.

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a 33-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She has been a farmer since 1999. Today, Hanane is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to buy additional tools for her job in order to produce more products and buy more agricultural foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora RAQUEL, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 25 años y tiene un hijo. Su hijo se llama Guillermo tiene 8 meses de nacido.     

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de bocaditos (snack) con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que le solicitan los productos y les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más bocaditos pues en esta época de años es donde se vende más.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la foto la socia esta acompañada de su sobrina.
texts.en:
Sra. Raquel is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Luz del Mañana” (New Light of Tomorrow), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has an 8 month old son named Guillermo.

Motivated by her personality and desire to fulfill her dreams, Raquel started a business selling snacks. She has been gaining customers from the beginning and her earnings allow her to provide for her household. Today Raquel has regular customers who ask for her products, so she personally attends to each individual with her charismatic personality. She has been in this business for a number of years and has done very well as a result of all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who succeeds on behalf of her family despite facing adversity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more snacks since her sales are at their highest during this time of the year.

Raquel is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time. In the photo, she is accompanied by her niece.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide additional operating capital for her snack business

loans.name: Normalita's Group

texts.en:
Normalita A. is from the town of Nagbukel, San Isidro. She is 46 years old. Normalita is the leader of a seven member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Normalita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Normalita owns and operates a store selling cosmetics and silver jewelries. Normalita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Normalita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normalita is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cosmetics and silver jewelries. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Normalita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics and jewelries

loans.name: Hikoyathon

texts.ru: Раджабова Хикоятхон проживает в городе Курган- Тюбе. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Раджабова Хикоятхон работает в области торговли 3 года. Она продает детские велосипеды и калыбели. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. закупа детских колыбелок.
texts.en:
Hikoyathon R. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 51 years old, married and has 2 children. Hikoyathon has been working in the retail sales field for 3 years. She sells kids' bicycles and cribs. She is obtaining this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. purchase children's cribs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Amarsaikhan

texts.en: Amarsaikhan is 44 years old and lives in Baganuur, a small town about an hour or so drive from UB (Ulan Bator).  He moved to Baganuur in 2007 with his family. He lives in an apartment with his wife, Narantuya, and his daughter and son, Anu and Anand.  He and his wife have been working together in their pants shop since 2008.  Right now, they rent a one-room apartment to sell their pants. With the loan, Amarsaikhan wants to open another shop that he will be able to have at the busy market where more people will be able to buy his stuff.  Amarsaikhan doesn’t drink, is humble, almost to a fault, honest, and very responsible with money. He hopes to be able to open many branches of his business someday.

loans.use: To open another shop

loans.name: Alexis Clemente

texts.es: El Sr. Alexis Clemente Solís Sánchez, soltero, de oficio jardinero, su especialidad es la poda de árboles ornamentales, su crédito lo solicito para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, con la institución es su tercer crédito y dice sentirse satisfecho con las oportunidades que le brinda CEPRODEL de pagar sus  abonos de acuerdo a sus fechas de pagos, además que le ofrece cuotas acorde con su salario.
texts.en:
Alexis Clemente Solís Sánchez is single. He's a gardener and his specialty is ornamental tree trimming. He is asking for funding to make some home improvements. This is his 3rd loan with the institution and he says that he is content with the opportunities that CEPRODEL offers to repay his loan in addition to the fact that repayment amounts are based on his salary.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Elias Ernesto

texts.es: Don Elias de edad de 49 años, se dedica a dos oficios, es albañil desde su juventud, y destaza cerdo, como a veces los proyectos de trabajos se detienen por falta de ingresos. El comenzó a invertir en cerdo lo cual cuando no tiene trabajo gana en sus productos de carne, venta de chicharrón, manteca, fritos, moronga entre otros. El inicio como albañil debido a que su papa trabajaba y le enseño  el oficio,  ya que era el  sustento de su familia. Con su esposa procreo tres hijos, estudiantes de la secundaria, su esposa a parte que le ayuda con el destace de cerdo es costurera y juntos han logrado el capital. Las dificultades que se le dieron fue la gripe porcina ya que se prohibió el destace del cerdo lo cual sus ventas decayeron y quedo trabajando con poco capital. Gracias a la ganancia de sus trabajos adquirió una camioneta con la que transporta los cerdo y la venta de carne, pero el mantenimiento de la camioneta se lo da con los financiamiento ya que invierte en el vehiculo en la compra de llantas, que en el crédito anterior compro llantas de segunda mano por que no ajusto con el dinero. Es con el financiamiento que  hace toda las mejoras para el vehiculo ya que no ajusta para esta inversión que es parte de instrumento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Elias age 49, is engaged in two trades, he is a mason since his youth, and he is also a pig butcher as sometimes jobs are stopped due to lack of funding. He started investing in pigs when he did not have a job. He earned money from the sale of meat product such as pork skins, butter, fried blood sausage among others. His start as a home as a builder he owes to his father who taught him the trade, as it was how their family was sustained. He has 3 high-school age children with his wife who helps with the butchering and is also a seamstress to earn money. Difficulties arose with swine flu [H1N1] as the butchering of pork was banned and sales dropped, so he is working with very little capital. Thanks to the earnings from his other jobs, he acquired a truck with which he transports the pork and sells the meat but the maintenance of the truck is provided with money he has already invested in the truck in the form of tires. His previous loan was used for the purchase of second-hand tires which made made money tight to provide maintenance on the truck. With the new loan he would be able to make at the improvements to the truck without having to scrimp to invest in this essential business instrument.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires for the truck and provide necessary maintenance

loans.name: Lochin

texts.ru: Ашурматов Лочин проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Лочин более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует землю, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Lochin A. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Lochin has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He leases land, where he grows vegetables. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Vy Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 10 people of this village bank loan, located in Kou Duol village in Takeo province, selected Mrs. S. Vy N. as a village bank president. Each member will use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. S. Vy N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice to support her family’s living. She also breeds pigs at her home. She has a problem because her pigs are too small to sell.

In order to improve her family’s living conditions Mrs. S. Vy N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Houm, is a construction worker. Through these activities, the couple supports three children who attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig food for breeding pigs.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja y fruto de su unión tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. Vive en la localidad de Palmapampa, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su casa propia.

Para ella no existe lo imposible, es por ello que su deseo de ampliar su tienda de abarrotes es un objetivo próximo. Para ello, se ha propuesto trabajar de manera constante, por lo que sus ventas están mejorando con el pasar de los meses. Por estas satisfacciones agradece a su padre, por lo buenos consejos que lo dio cuando empezó a independizarse. 
Sus horas de trabajo se incrementaron con respecto al año anterior, trabaja desde las 5:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM; por lo general atiende sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja y de sus hijos (en tiempo de vacaciones).

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tal motivo agradece el respaldo que le están brindando, además confía en que ser parte de un banco comunal le será muy beneficioso. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mariza is 29 years old and lives with her partner and their two young children. They live in Palmapampa, which is in the Peruvian jungle, and they have their own home. For Mariza nothing is impossible. Her next goal is to make an addition on her grocery store. In order to reach this goal she is working constantly. This has helped her increase her sales over the course of several months. She thanks her father for her success because he gave her good advice when she left home and became independent. She has extended her business hours over the last year and is now open from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM. She generally works alone, but sometimes she gets help from her husband or from her kids when they are on vacation from school. This is her first loan with MFP and she is thankful for the support they have offered. She believes that being part of the community bank will be very positive fore her. She will use the loan money to stock up her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory for grocery store

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia C. lives in the village of Misom. She is 38 years old, married, has four school-aged children and makes a living by selling dry goods to people in her community. She has been in this line of work for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Felecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans from PMPC, and used them to expand her business. She is applying for a new loan, for 7,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell in her store.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife P. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Marife is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to have the ability to engage in business activities. Marife is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en: 22-year-old Lovelyn S. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has children aged 4 and 2. Lovelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month. Lovelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lovelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia D. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Sonia is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 15,0000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gbemissola Lydie

texts.fr: A. Gbemissola Lydie est née le 31 Juillet 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DAOUDA Abossi Soulé, un commerçant, Lydie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis environs quatre ans, Lydie vit à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-POdji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Lydie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et appris ensuite la coiffure. Lydie mène cette activité depuis sept ans. De façon secondaire, Lydie vend dans son atelier, des mêches, des produits pour cheveux, et également des tissus. Lydie s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Lydie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'attirer plus la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Gbemissola Lydie was born July 31, 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to Mr. DAOUDA Abossi Soulé, a merchant, and is the mother of four children who are all in school.  She has been living for about four years in PK10, in the community of Sèmè-POdji, with her husband and children.  The couple jointly provide for their family.   Lydie halted her studies in middle school and then learned how to style hair.  She has been in this business for seven years.  Secondarily, she sells hair extensions, hair products, and also fabrics out of her shop.  She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  This is the first time that Lydie has requested a loan from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering her business and attracting more customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extentions, hair products, equipment, etc.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly A. O. is twenty-two years old. She is married and has two children aged eight years and four years respectively. Her business is located at a busy business area called Katito in Kisumu. She sells men's clothes, shoes and bags. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge is that some of the items she sells are slow moving therefore reducing profits. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to expand her stock of clothes to grow her business and be able to meet her customers' needs. She hopes to expand her business and even open her own boutique. In future, she sees herself becoming a wholesaler. She describes herself as very hardworking, honest and God-fearing.

loans.use: expand her clothing inventory

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente  tiene1 Hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como ortodontista, La socia estudio y se graduó en técnica dental, ella apoya a los odontólogos con las prótesis y ortodoncia en general; Ella tiene en su casa su pequeño consultorio, ella va a implementar un poco mas su consultorio y a comprar unos materiales también. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en consultorio dental en casa. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Ana is 25 years old, lives with her life partner and her son, and works as an orthodontist assistant, having studied and graduated from a technical dental school. She provides prosthetics for dentists and supports dentists in general, from an office in her home. She wants to expand her office, and also buy some supplies. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in her home office. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand home office

loans.name: Dodaroy

texts.en:
M. Dodaroy, 52, runs a drug store and sells only certified medicines.  It's located in the center of town which allows her to have many customers.  Dodaroy has been in business for over 15 years.  

Dodaroy has been a client of IMON for more than three years.  She requests a 7300 Somoni loan.  Dodaroy says she will repay the loan without any violations.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

Loan has been repaid successfully 

Tillaeva Mehriniso is thankful to Kiva and all the lenders. With the loan she increased the number of her medicine in her drug store that helped her to make her drug store more famous. Mehriniso said, with the profit, she repaired the family house and improved her family living. She is looking forward for more loans from Kiva to further expand her business. Mehriniso thanks once again everyone who supported her as exactly your timely assistance allowed her developing her business.

loans.use: Expanding the business.
